Reviews.Title: “Superior Rooms, Above Average Amenities”
Reviews.Author: webducks74
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel a 5 rating if I had more than one night there and experienced the same level of service consistantly. We stopped just for one night on our trip from Lisbon to Seville as the hotel is just a few blocks from Atocha Station--the main international train station in Madrid. Our room was very modern, beautifully designed and with more than adequate space. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Something one rarely sees: a refrigerator replete with not only water, but juice and sodas--complimentary. The beds were excellent and as alluded to above, the location was very good as well. A top value as well as the price was what one would normally pay for a 2 star in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for eight days. Convinient to many Museums, Resturants, and Shows. No need for a car yet if you have one there is no parking nearby. Best to pay for Valet service at the hotel. The staff was very helpful and had great suggestions on where to eat and what to see in the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for good price”
Reviews.Author: FromNYinDC
Reviews.Content: Pretty simple hotel but it's nice. Convenient location by the train and walking distance to many tourist sites. Hotel staff was nice but they didn't know much about the train system going outside of Madrid. However, overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful room, great value”
Reviews.Author: andrewcrosby
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel, but our Jr. Suite room was lux. Service was good and the room was very well appointed and new; nice bathroom with plush towels, a great shower. Room divided with sliding pocket door for privacy with queen bed on one side and sofa bed on the other. Good location close to many sites. Worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “Madrid Muey Beuno”
Reviews.Author: sherry j
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights a tthe AC Hotel Carlton Madrid by Marriott. This was a good stay and we were very pleased with the hotel. Madrid is beautiful, there are lots of things to do. I was concerned about the hot weather but since there is no humitity, it was very pleasant. I picked the Carlton because I wanted a modern hotel with a comfortable bed and air conditioning. The room is smaller than US standards. The price was very good so we booked two adjoining rooms for us and our Daughter. We could have had a room with three single beds but for 15 more euro per day we had two rooms. A king size bed in our room and two singles pushed together in the other room. Very comfortable firm beds. The bathrooms were all tile, glass and very modern. The bathrooms all have glass sliding doors which I liked because they are very quiet. Nice LG TV hanging on the wall but the only station in English was the BBC network. This turned out to be a plus for us as we usually end up coming home after dinner and watching the tube. Since the tube was limited we went out, stayed out late and got on the Spanish time zone which is a late dinner and sleeping in. There is a small fridge in the room and they supply free water and soda daily. The maid turns off the air conditioning when she cleans so it has to be turned on daily when you return from sight seeing. I wasn't crazy about the area, although it is close to the train station and two metro stations, it is not in the tourist area so there aren't a lot of nice restaurants around. I was concerned about crime/pickpockets that I had read about but felt very safe here. Speaking Spanish would be a big plus, but most people speak some English and our Daughter who speaks a little Spanish was able to translate for us. Some restaurants have English menus, ask for one. I'm not willing to order food unless I know what it is. We loved the Hop on/Hop off bus and would recommend doing this the first or second day, this will help you decide what You want to see. The Prada Museum was unbelievable, You really need more than one day to see it all. We did not care for the Sophia Reyna Modern Art Museum. We took the train to Toledo it's an easy day trip. Enjoy Madrid, we sure did.

Reviews.Title: “Went with toddler, had a good stay. Good access to train and buses. Rooms modern.”
Reviews.Author: PinkAddict
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 5 days stay in Madrid and hotel was good access. Bed was big enough to fit my toddler in the middle. Room was spacious (room 205) enough space to put stuff and stroller. Even had some weak wifi signal from the lobby! Slow Internet though. Lobby reception didn't speak good English when we checked in. Other days the staff were friendly and finally informed us that we could pass with the stroller through a back door (instead of all the pain we had passing through the revolving door!). The mini bar drinks were free and refilled everyday. However twice the cleaning lady didn't fill up our mineral water and toiletries. Not sure if she forgot intentionally?!? Had to call lobby and they were very prompt in sending it to the room. Rooms were modern which I loved. Good tv had a cartoon channel to keep daughter busy while we had to prepare stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and rea$onable!”
Reviews.Author: ILUS
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, with a location that is easily accessible to the airport (via bus) and the train station! It offers modern, clean rooms with flat-panel TVs, new baths, and free non-alcoholic drinks. Staff is helpful and bi-lingual. Look for special deals on the Marriott website, which gave us a terrific price break. As others have commented, it is difficult navigating the stairs to the front desk with luggage and the elevators are tiny, but the hotel is safe, very comfortable, and private. In m view, the sole downside of staying here is that the neighborhood does not offer good restaurants, as this is a mediocre area of Madrid; however, there are many pluses to the area (such as evening hours as the Reina Sophia museum).

Reviews.Title: “Good enough, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: ellen0206
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for super cheap - so admittedly, this review is biased a bit based on our cost. Hotel is convenient to the Atocha train station (and, obviously, Atocha subway stop as well) - which is the main reason we chose it as we were taking the train from Madrid to Seville several days into the trip. Note that the airport express bus (much cheaper than a cab) also stops at Atocha and the walk is very easy and not far to this hotel (just don't try to cut around the back side of the train station, which I did the first time ... it looks - and is - closer but you have to cut through a maze of cabs and tiny sidewalks). Anyway, the hotel's entrance - as noted by others - isn't the most user-friendly with luggage as it has both stairs and a revolving door ... but once you're checked in, it's obviously not a big deal. Same goes for the super tiny elevators. Proximity to museums is very good, proximity to good dining options is average. Rooms are small but clean. Helpful and multilingual front-desk staff. All in all, would return if the price was the same.

Reviews.Title: “Brill Stay”
Reviews.Author: Desmond B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the AC Hotel Carlton with my girlfriend in April 2012 for a weekend; we got a taxi from the airport to the hotel which was about £30. The hotel was right next to the train station which was brilliant inside. When we arrived and went straight to are room. The room was clean and modern with a big TV with only BBC news a mini fridge with drinks in the bed was large and very comfortable. The room service was expensive. Overall the room and hotel was great and the service from the staff was also excellent. The location was okay but walking to the centre of Madrid was 20 minutes ALL UPHILL. I would recommend this hotel to anyone you just have to be wary of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: yeungman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights (July 15 to 19) and really enjoyed our clean and spacious room (601) with free non-alcoholic drinks in the mini-bar. Prior to arrival, I called the hotel to confirm our reservation and talked to Julio who was very courteous and accomodating with my higher floor/quiet room request...indeed he is a great asset to the hotel. We booked our room in late Jan 2012 and took advantage of the hotel's free buffet breakfast offer (15 Euro pp). The room rate was very resonable at 91E inc taxes. The hotel location is very convenient - near the Atocha Renfe and 2 metro stations. We took the Airport shuttle bus from/to airport at 5E each. We also bought strips of 10 metro tickets at 12E per strip which we used to go visit attractions in the city center. The Prado, Sofia Reina and Thyssen Museums and the Retiro Park are within walking distance. We did 2 day trips and took the Renfre train at Atocha Station to Toledo and the Sepúlveda bus at Principe Pio metro stop to Segovia. We would definitely use this hotel again on future visits to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: FRWL
Reviews.Content: I'll start off saying that the staff is very friendly, helpful and accommodating. But the staff does not design the interior nor plan out the hotel or room layout.  Problem number one - a somewhat dangerous main entrance: it is a large automatic revolving door, on the corner of the building. When you arrive in blinding sun, you cannot see past the door's glass panes. I was hauling a heavy suitcase, with a duffel bag on top of it, and got stuck in the door. As I was fighting the door, and progressing towards the lobby, I almost fell off the steps - which are practically at the edge of the revolving as you enter the lobby. That was not a good start. There is no ramp to roll down a suitcase, so beware as you plan your stay.  Problem number two - very noisy hallways: don't know if it's because a large tourist group checked in, but the stomping down the halls and loud voices outside the door and behind the walls carried well past midnight. Other Problem number three: awful hard mattresses!  Torturous sleep: felt like a plank of wood.  Other CONS: the room lighting is too dim, and insufficient. The lighting in the bathroom is absolutely prohibitive to attempting to apply make-up: I can't help but think that no females were on the interior decor team! The color scheme is quite dark, and the property is all about stark lines.  The lobby is somewhat on a small side, with a compact bar stand attended by staff in the evening.  There is a restaurant on site, which will serve you in the lobby.  But the lobby was usually quite full, as guests were using complimentary Wi-fi: else, you have to pay, is accessed from the room - BUT due to the Wi-Fi set up, it's only available on the lower 2-3 floors.  PROS:  as mentioned, attentive & helpful staff. Complimentary mini-bar with a variety of soft drinks, replenished daily. Very good central location within walking distance of the Atocha train station, metro and some key attractions. A mini-mart / convenience store is one block away, if you have a craving for chocolate and none handy. ;-) We used points to stay here, so I cannot objectively grade the value, if you were a paying guest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rish G
Reviews.Content: We ( myself and my wife) stayed at AC carlton Madrid from 9th-12th June 2012 . The hotel is conveniently located near Atocha main station ( 5 mins walk ) and Atocha Subway ( 5-7 mins walk ) which connects you to all other parts of Madrid . It is close to Prada museum , and other attractions . The rooms very very modern with free mini-bar which is a huge upside . The people at the front desk were extremely polite and helpful . The lobby has free wi-fi which is an added bonus . the breakfast is nice with good spread , although they don;t make any efforts to so variations , it was exactly the same for the four days we spent in the hotel I don't see any downside of staying in this hotel apart from the fact that it is not in the middle of Madrid where all the action is , but i guess it is conveniently located . I would return to Carlton Madrid again .

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: houcltraveller
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. I stayed in this hotel twice in the month of June (once solo, and then with the kids). Pros: 1) Super clean rooms with comfortable beds. 2) Free non-alcohol mini-bar (how can I not put this in here). 3) Accessibility to train station (5 mins to Atocha and a 20 min direct train to the Airport from Atocha). 4) 5 to 10 min walk to the museums. 5) Plenty of food options. 6) (last but not the least) Courteous hotel personnel. Cons: None (yes..believe it or not). Footnote: The last night we stayed with the kids was the euro final. The place was ecstatic.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable....”
Reviews.Author: Joanne313
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, quiet, comfortable hotel. It is close to the the Atocha train station, the Metro, the Reina Sofia, Prado, and the botanical gardens. Rooms are cozy small, but adequate. The shower glass door could be two inches longer to prevent the bathroom from getting wet. Did not use any other facilities. Had no issues finding the hotel. Take the $5 euro airport bus to the Atocha station, then walk to the hotel in 5 min.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location by atocha station”
Reviews.Author: modiindia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in June 2012. It is a good hotel with enough breakfast , walkable distance from Sol as well as Plaza Mayor( the most interesting areas of Madrid) also near Prado And museum of art. Rooms are not very large but you can opt for bigger rooms if you are traveling with children. The front desk staff is helping and only one lady was little rude but probably she was too busy. There is a nice flee market near the hotel and tripadvisor has the details. Worth visiting in the morning time. They shut shops at two pm. Form atocha station, this hotel is walking distance and don't be fooled by the taxi people who will want you to ride one. No need for taxi. If r going to Toledo, catch a train from Atocha. It is very convenient. From airport to this hotel also you can come by renfe' train in 3uros. Nothing special about this place but location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, clean”
Reviews.Author: nicko591
Reviews.Content: after arriving in Madrid early on a Sunday morning from a transatlantic flight, it was a relief to be welcomed with smiles and a room that was ready for us! Complimentary drinks in the ensuite mini fridge we also much appreciated. We were able to take a nap and be refreshed and ready to visit the Prado that afternoon which was an easy walk from the hotel, which by the way is free after 5 on Sunday. reina Sofia Museum, Puerta del Sol and Retiro Park are also easy walking distance. atocha train station was a five minute walk from the hotel. Lots of bars and cafes to choose from, no worries about where to eat. Back to the hotel, it is incredibly clean, very modern, and a pleasure to stay in, would definitely return. Junior suite was worth the price for an incredibly comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: atorr052
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! We couldn't ask for more! The hotel was about two blocks or less from the Atocha Station which is the central station in Madrid. We were about 2-3 blocks away from La Reina Sophia Museum. Also walking distance to El Prado and El Retiro Park. Although it is not near the city center, the metro from the Atocha station leaves you RIGHT there! The staff was very nice. I'm not sure if there was free wifi in the lobby. We are gold members so we had free wifi in the rooms. ONLY problem was getting ice. There was always a problem with getting ice. The room was very nice, great quality furniture. I would definitely return and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fair but not great”
Reviews.Author: Alex L
Reviews.Content: Pros - free mini-bar - Marriott-chain: so if you are a regular Marriott customers, it is a definite pro. That was the main reason for my stay - close to train station - room is modernized - great shower (big enough for a couple) Cons - shower is mirror-wall and can see through. So, while great for couple, it is not the room to share with your teenage daughter. Suspect that it is the same for all rooms. - wifi not free in room - bit far from center city Summary - if travel as individual or a couple and don't mind a bit away from sol, not a bad place. If travel with teens, make sure ask about the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Adjoining rooms - clean, convenient and pleased”
Reviews.Author: libba
Reviews.Content: We had two adjoining rooms for our three night stay at this property. The rooms were quite different, with one (106) being a smaller "pie" shape and the other (107) being a more standard rectangle. One bath had a full tub and shower, and the other (the pie shape room) had a shower only. Both rooms however were spotless and of course included the free mini-fridge!! You need to request a key to use the safe - we did. The AC worked beautifully for us Texans. And the towels were large and medium thickness. They provided bath gel, shower cap, comb, etc. whichs is always appreciated. Our rate included breakfast and the buffet included hot items and cold, protein and carbs. One small point to keep in mind is if you order a coke a breakfast you will pay extra for it though it is free in the rooms! As this was a girls trip, safety and location were important. I'm pleased to note the location was very safe night and daytime, and it appeared that this was a very residential neighborhood of families and singles. There are a few restaurants nearby, we ate at a couple and were satisfied with the quality and price of the menu. We walked only one time to Puerto del Sol and it was quite a walk. But doable. Easy walk to the Prado for us. There was some street noise (we faced a quiet street) early on a weekend morning, but not so disruptive that it kept anyone awake. The AC Carlton is a very nice hotel in a European chain (meaning we American's shouldn't expect similar size to US hotels rooms or elevators.) We were very pleased with the comfort and the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and handy for Atocha”
Reviews.Author: anotherhotelreview
Reviews.Content: For the price of £72 per night room only, I thought this place was a bargain. The AC chain has recently joined the Marriott brand and although it is not a full service chain generally the AC hotels are very good. This one is an easy 5 minute walk from the Atocha train station which is the main train station in Madrid and has a 25 minute train to the airport. The hotel is nothing to look at from the outside but although a bit of an older hotel has been refurbished well inside. The room we had was fine and had everything we needed for a three night city break. Not luxury but clean and welcoming. We had a room only rate so cannot comment on the food and bar. There is a bar area in the entrance and places to sit and eat if you wish, many did however there are far more Spanish choices just outside the hotel. You are close to the Prado museum and about a 20 minute walk to the main areas with restaurants bars and shops. Outside the hotel is fine, it feels just like a central Madrid local’s neighbourhood. Fine to walk about day or night. I would recommend the hotel for people arriving via train and not afraid of a little walk in to the centre. You will save plenty by the time you add taxi prices and more expensive hotel sin the very centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Henry J
Reviews.Content: Short walking distance to Metro stops and the Atocha train station. Walking distance to the Prado, Thyssen Bornemisza and the Reina Sofia museums. Nice local markets near by for basic grocery shopping. Hotel was clean and pleasant staff was accommodating. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: Ratpacker
Reviews.Content: Te first thing that I didn't like about the hotel was you have to go up steps to get to a revolving door and go down stairs to get to the reception. Not a great first impression when you have luggage. It's a smallish hotel, our room was nice, clean, decent sized with a contemporary bathroom. We arrived on a Saturday, a short walk from the train station. The street was very quiet and most places were closed since it looked like an office area. The hotel is close to the museums, botanical gardens and retiro park. The metro is about a 5 minute walk. Its a little away from the city center but not bad. Helpful and friendly staff. I wish the Marriotts would have free wifi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “VERY, BUT VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: Latinoamericano1
Reviews.Content: is my first time at this hotel. rooms are very good, beds are very comfortable, service is nice and the minibar is included in the price. is not a bargain but is a very good price. the hotel is also very close to atocha so you can take the metro or the train or the express bus to the airport very soon. the street is not so crowdy so you can easily take a taxi cab.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but outside from the city center”
Reviews.Author: Mikicino
Reviews.Content: If you expect the Marriott standards you won't be satisfied by this hotel, the rooms are not so updated while the lobby is modern. If you're a Marriott rewards member be aware that your benefits are not taking in account by the hotel staff neither the requests made with the reservation form. The cleanliness was ok!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel outside central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: gigapoke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in May. Large, clean, well decorated room. Well stocked free mini bar was a pleasant find. Our room faced the street but didn't have any problems w/ traffic noise. There's some street construction going on so could hear the jack hammer, but wasn't bad. It's very close to Reina Sofia but a bit of a hike to Puerta del Sol and other areas further west. There are very limited dining options nearby, especially for dinner. Free wireless in lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Modern, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jamibart
Reviews.Content: We knew it was a Marriott and had low expectations, but this place was spotless, quiet, chic and modern and very, very comfortable. Deep bath, deep mattress, flat-screen tv, complimentary mini bar, free wifi in the lobby, and a great breakfast. Why they don't charge tons more is beyond me. If you're up for a short walk to the Prado that is not jaw-gapingly pretty, but completely fine, book with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises - basic, friendly and central”
Reviews.Author: MrMacP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for 2 nights with business conference nearby. Only 20mins cab from Barajas about 25E. Super slow and cramped lift but the hotel did not feel full itself. Very easy for Reina Sofia and Prado, Retiro, Atocha station etc. Walkable to Sol and Pl St Ana. Great bus links down to Legazpi. Good reception staff with French and English spoken. They dont make you feel stupid if you try your Spanish. Room a bit small but dark and cool. Free mini bar. Large TV with BBC. Good bathroom, slightly temperamental shower (freezing-boiling). Good selection at breakfast for c.8E. The district is down at heel, lots of shut-down shops, graffiti, a few non-threatening beggars and homeless, but also families, schoolkids, dog-walkers, streetcafes and OAPs around. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station and La Prada”
Reviews.Author: nlb43
Reviews.Content: For the price of this hotel I expected a little bit more. The room was nice and comfortable but the fact that wifi is only free in the lobby really bothered me. For 8 euros a day you could have it in your room, which is a bit pricey. The lobby was small and did not offer much. My room keycard kept losing its ability to open my door and I had to return to the lobby at least 4 times during my 24 hour stay. The hotel is walking distance to Achoa Train station and walking distance to La Prada, and a couple of other museums. There is also a fantastic park nearby that is great for running and walking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob M
Reviews.Content: Walked to this hotel from Atocha train station, took five minutes. Overall, this is a very good hotel. Excellent reception lounge and restaurant. Our room faced the inner court and was nice and quiet. Ammenities top rate. Beds comfy. Bath clean and modern. Excellent location for tourists. Highly recommended. Wifi on first two floors, spotty higher up. But it is free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Clean and Confort”
Reviews.Author: aleterruggi
Reviews.Content: This hotel are perfect to stay in Madrid , room are spacious , clean , new , and with wood ground, amazing people serving you , good breakfast , near train station , stores , market .....

Reviews.Title: “Functional Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurobeni
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a busy street in a not great area. We booked as we wanted to be near the train station however it's not a walk if you have bags. Thre is a small bar onto the reception arae which is functional, not much more and it closes bang on midnight. Service at check-in was very slow but in the morning efficient. The room was comfortable and the bed was great. I had to purchase wi-fi access as the "free" signal wasn't strong enough. .

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity to Prado and train station.”
Reviews.Author: hoosick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on our way out of Spain after taking high speed train from Seville. Easy walk to hotel with luggage. Nice lobby lounge with internet access and great table service. Elevators are SUPER tiny but there are two so getting to and from is doable without a lot of hassle. Room was spacious (even with extra cot) and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice people, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MSYCajun
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days and enjoyed our stay. The free mini-bar (no beer or wine included, we had no Marriott status) was a nice touch. There was fairly strong wi-fi in the lobby and a bit of a free single in our room (2 floors up, almost over the lobby). Some street noise, significantly muffled by lowering the outside shade. Some internal noise from neighboring rooms, but nothing that made it hard to sleep (perhaps they grouped all sedate types together?). No restaurant, but room service could be had in the room or in the lobby, which was pleasant the one night we tried it. Front desk folks were pleasant to all. We were allowed to check in around noon, as a room was available. Great value for a great location in Madrid - would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to the Prado”
Reviews.Author: flomap
Reviews.Content: This AC Hotel is a nice walking distance to the big three art museums in Madrid. It is very clean and the rooms are of a nice size. The service was quite good. We had a little problem with our check-in because we changed our dates on the Marriott website, received email confirmation of the change but the hotel never received the change from the Marriott reservation system. The desk clerk was very gracious and found us rooms that were good for us. We needed two rooms--one a triple, which was a little tricky to manage. He did a good job and managed to straighten everything out with Marriott so we were not charged a no-show for the original dates. We were on the front side of the hotel facing the street and did not have a problem with street noise. Our daughter and her husband ate breakfast in the hotel one morning and thought it was quite good. Madrid is large enough that some areas were a distance from the hotel. We walked to some areas and took cabs back and found the cabs to be very reasonable. There is an indoor food market about 4 blocks from the hotel that is pretty interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalistic comfort”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Carlos_G
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for a very nice and cozy hotel. My room was one of the smallest I ve ever been but I found it very nice.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE AT CHECKOUT TIME..........”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutGuy1905
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 nights at this hotel and liked it very much but be careful when you pay your bill using a U.S. credit card as they will automatically convert to US dollars at an exhorbitant rate. When I saw this on my receipt they simply said it was for "informational purposes" only and assured me that the exchange rate would be processed by my bank. This was completely false as the amount that posted to my credit card account was the exact dollar amount reflected on the receipt below Euro total. Of course, they did it with a smile on their face and in a very reassuring way so that you wouldnt have any reason to suspect you were being taken advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent lunch/breakfast, very nice room, reasonable rate.”
Reviews.Author: retired_old_jj
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I was only there one night but I was quite impressed. I got there at 10AM, thanks to intercontinental airplane schedules, they were quite accomodating (yes, do tell them in advance), understood that I wanted to SLEEP, friendly front desk, not great in English, but effective, and of course, this is Madrid, Spain, not New Madrid, Missouri. My reservation was through a University in Madrid, so I may have gotten better than rack rate, I don't know for sure. Regardless, for a city hotel, it's a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...but location not that Central”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: Fabulous long weekend away with a friend to Madrid. Had a lovely stay at AC Carlton. We had a lovely Superior Room, clean, modern, and spacious throughout main sleeping area and the bathroom. Nicely decorated rooms. Mini .bar is free....didn't know until we enquired about buying water at the main bar. Staff were helpful and friendly, breakfast buffet was included with our reservation and was a good selection of food everyday. Lack of sound insultation, as can easily hear nosies from rooms above and next door and across the corridor. Hotel itself very close to Reina Sofia Museum, Atocha main train station and Botanical garden/park. It is a 20 minute walk to the main City centre but there are various routes to take and you will discover various bars, restuarants, places of interests along the way. Would be perfect hotel if location was slightly closer to the centre of the main attractions but the bus tours will get you out and about too and you can hop on and off at your leisure. Great weekend. Madrid full of culture. If you run out of Euros, head to Museum de Jamon - chain of ham eateries selling lovely breads and spanish speciality hams....also very very very cheap drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--very close to the Renfe Atocha train station”
Reviews.Author: jessejean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a trip to Spain. The location is great especially if you plan to use the Renfe train system. It's about a 5 minute walk to the train station. The rest of the area is alright, but a 10-15 minute walk gets you into nicer areas in Madrid. We walked to the palace in around 20 minutes. The front desk is knowledgeable and helpful, and they speak good English.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable comfort, good location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ala13
Reviews.Content: We (a mature couple) stayed at this hotel for three nights in March 2012. With he exception of the dangerous steps inside the main entrance, we liked everything about it - location, decor, price. It is located close to the train station so we were able to walk to the hotel on our way back from Malaga. It is also within walking distance of El Prado Museum and other attractions. Free WiFi is available in the lobby and at additional cost in the room. There is a bar/cafe in the lobby that offers snacks and refreshments throughout the day, as well as a restaurant that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Gulnara A
Reviews.Content: We were three families staying in this hotel and we really enjoyed our stay. Absolutely perfect locations- just three minutes by walking from Atocha train station and Metro which helps you to get even to the Airport for very low price and only 20 min. the hotel situated on a walking distance from Botanic garden, Prado museum, Retiro Park. Very close to Reina Sofia museum. Very nice breakfast - actualy after reading the reviews a was afraid to have poor selection, however I was really surprised to see very extended menu. They had almost everything from scrumbled eggs to fruits and from hamon to tortillas. Nice selecation of pastries.Very nice and attentive waiters. Free and fast internet in a lobby. Free minibar- which is very usefull after all day walking in a city especiallly if you are with kids. Air-conditioning was working perfectly. What I liked the most - the room has windows that open and you can get a fresh air. Big flat screen TV in the room. Good job and thanks to everyone for making our stay that pleasant and enjoyable. I will definitely stay there next time and I highly recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: jjstives
Reviews.Content: We were delighted in every way with the Carlton, even though this is not a standard Marriott Hotel. The hotel is not well known and we had to direct Taxi drivers to it. The Marriott relationship is unclear and not evident in the hotel. If you book it, you need to be aware of the pros and cons, especially if you use Reward points. But the hotel is part of a very large chain in Spain with a good reputation. The location is very good. It is about three short blocks from the modern and convenient Atosha Rail Terminal. You can walk comfortably to lots of key attractions, museums and shops. Metro and bus service nearby. Plenty of restaurants close-by and, unlike so many communities near rail stations in Europe, the area around trhe hotel is apparently safe and you can walk around day and night without much concern. Madrid is extremely tourist friendly and we found many people anxious and willing to assist with directions, metro tickets, etc, so don’t be afraid to ask for help. Front desk was helpful and had at least one English-speaker at all times. Our room (210) overlooked a side street and on the 2nd floor which is really the 4th floor, the way the building is designed, (ground floor is “Hall,” then O, 1, 2, etc). There was some street noise evident, even with windows closed and steel shutters rolled down, but it was tolerable. The lobby/lounge is nothing special, offers free WIFI. but again it is adequate. No smoking in the area, so that’s a plus. (Spain’s no smoking in public facilities policy is still unclear and apparently lightly enforced. We asked for a non-smoking room and ours was fine without any trace of smoke, but the room across the hall was sending smoke out into the hall one afternoon.) The room and bath were very good, very clean and maid service was excellent. Door had key card and secure lock. Safe in room worked well and you must obtain a key from the front desk (no charge) for your safe. Plenty of good hanging closet space and drawers. The room has a sliding glass panel which, if you desire, divides the area for comfort and privacy. Good, clean towels, sheets, linens and outstanding bath amenities were replaced daily. Soft drinks and water in fridge are free and refilled daily. This is a worthwhile feature and makes the room price an even better deal. Plenty of power outlets for recharging laptop, phone, etc. Beds were comfortable and well made every day. Flat screen TV on wall. Quality reception, but don’t expect English channels. This is Spain, remember? There is 24 hour food and beverage service available from the lounge or as room service. A late snack mixed salad was fresh and well done. Prices were reasonable. Breakfast, which we only enjoyed one day, was excellent with plenty of choices and priced at 16 Euros each. Most days we went out and got bakery rolls from across the street. I booked directly through Marriott Web site and our 6 night stay came to about $830 total. Overall, this was a good hotel choice. One other note: I booked through the Marriott web site and could have cancelled up to the last minute and did not pay until we left the hotel. When traveling abroad, I have found this arrangement preferable to paying up front.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - near trains, no free wifi”
Reviews.Author: dkim76
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - relatively modern. Hoping for free wifi, but only in the lobby. Was nearby the Atocha station, which was very convenient for travelling - both long distance on the Renfe, as well as locally on the Metro. The area around is okay - seems a little sketchy, but not bad. Overall, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel in an OK location”
Reviews.Author: mkalen1
Reviews.Content: Its a basic property. Clean and somewhat centrally located. It's a clean hotel at a fair price. The free mini bar was nice. Some nice snacks and drinks. The bed was hard and the king size bed is two twins tied together. You can fall through the cracks at night! The heating and AC was hard to operate and didn't work right. Parking is reasonable at 14 euros. Breakfast is an extra charge, even If you are a Marriott platinum member.

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: Srnka R
Reviews.Content: The hotel webpage claims the following: "AC Hotel Carlton Madrid has introduced a free Wi-Fi internet service in the hotel, providing easy access to a high-speed connection." This is a lie. The free wi-fi is only available in the lobby; you have to pay for it in rooms. The in-room directory of services mentioned a pool and a spa, but the lady at the reception seemed to hear about that for the first time. There is no bath, only a shower. The walls are very thin, you can hear everything that goes on around you. The location is excellent, walking distance to Reina Sofia, Prado, the botanic garden, and much more. Metro station Atocha is nearby. It is possible to get from the airport to the hotel just by using the metro (change of lines needed).

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Health_Care_Lawyer
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively small property right off of a main plaza with easy access to the Prado and other sights and 10 minutes walk from the Atocha Train Station. Front desk staff very good, the breakfast buffet was a welcome "american" breakfast as a change from the usual. We had a 1 bedroom junior suite; this are a bit dark as they are on the atrium not facing the street but quiet and wonderfully large for a European hotel. Great value in February and Marriott points as well

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except for the heating”
Reviews.Author: rbgs
Reviews.Content: This was a stylish hotel at a good price. We stayed two nights and the first night was fine, but on the second, the heating seemed to go into overdrive. The only way the room was comfortable was with the a/c on full and the window wide open (and it was -4C outside!). We complained at reception (which was also overheated) and they said they'd send an engineer while we were at dinner, but it was no better when we got back. The second night's sleep was awful due to the temperature. On the upside, the staff were friendly and helpful (to a point). The free mini-bar (non-alcoholic drinks only) was much appreciated. The location, near the central railway station is handy for the airport and day trips around the area. It's also walkable to the centre and main museums (around the corner from the Reina Sofia art gallery). For a railway station area, the neighbourhood is not bad. We didn't explore the local tapas bars, but they seemed to be full of locals, which seems like a good sign. The wi-fi and breakfast seemed overpriced, so we skipped them.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: TheGull
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotels com. Staff were helpful and the room was very clean and comfortable which was greatly appreciated after a 10 hour flight. Free mini bar in all room (non alcoholic drinks). Hotel room was Modern and very well kept There was a mix up at breakfast ( I had booked a room with breakfast, yet the 'list' showed I hadn't) which was quickly sorted out to my satisfaction. The breakfast was very good, All freshly made, Jamon Serano (pata negra), tortilla patata, pure fresh orange juice, cold meats etc etc. The choice, setting and the quality was excellent. Location is idea for transport links., Atoche Train & Metro (line 1) station is 400m east, (there's also a bus at the train station which takes you direct to the airport for 2Euros) 300m south of the hotel is Palos de la Fontera metro (Line 3) for the theatres on the northern/middle end of Gran via. (Callao metro station). Opposite entrance to Palos de la Fontera there are some cheap tapas bars serving food from fried Squid (3E) tapas, potato, egg and jamon casserole (6E) to the tortilla patata and burgers, also small supermarket till 2am near by, I will be booking this hotel when I return to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice near Atocha station”
Reviews.Author: frugaltravelerDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night during a recent trip to Madrid. We picked it because we wanted to catch the airport express bus near Atocha early in the morning and wanted something walkable. The hotel looks a bit dated from the outside, but the room was surprisingly updated and new. Large room, nice bathroom, free wifi in the lobby, good service (they printed out our boarding cards and were helpful with directions and general info). Some noise from other rooms/ outside, but was not intolerable in any way. Overall a good value stay near the station/reina Sofia etc.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed near Atocha”
Reviews.Author: move360
Reviews.Content: Located about 5 minutes walk from the Atocha metro station, near the Reina Sofia Museum. While not right in the heart of the city, it is pretty central as Madrid is very walkable, and of course you can always hop on the metro at Atocha. Also very convenient if you are arriving or departing by train, as the Atocha Renfe train station is also 5 minute walk away, saving you a cab ride or lugging your stuff on the subway. Very comfortable bed. Plenty of desk space for my laptop. The room had a small fridge/minibar – which had some water, sodas and juice and was free! Room was clean. Nice, modern bathroom. Staff was friendly and you can leave your bags with the front desk after you check out if needed. My room rate did not include breakfast. Internet – in the room – is extra. However, there is free wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but some reservations”
Reviews.Author: T3515
Reviews.Content: A simple map on the hotel's web page would make getting here much easier. It's very simple once you figure it out. The bed was very comfortable, linens clean, but the room is dated and lots of scrapes on the wall indicate that the room hasn't been painted in a few years. Noise is a problem here ... the hotel is in a U shape, so 4 doors are within feet of one another. If you like a place where you can hear slamming doors this is it. Wi-fi in the room is too expensive. Also no in-room coffee boiler or refrigerator. On balance this is an OK place to stay near the railway station, but I don't think it's a good overall value and definitely not what I expect from a Marriott-related hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but outdated facilities”
Reviews.Author: avaotto
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located close to Atocha railway station, the main hub for high speed rail in Spain (AVE). Rooms are nicely proportion but a bit tired and outdated. Good breakfast offering a wide range of products and dishes. Good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “A splendid place to stay in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Charming_Karl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel mostly on location - it is not far from the Atocha train station - but was pleasantly surprised to discover that is was a high quality place! The decor of the rooms was so interesting - my girlfriend, who is more widel traveled than I, said it reminded her of Japanese-style decor. While the room was not large, the space was used in economical, interesting ways. There was music in the bathroom, a sliding door to give the person using the bathroom privacy, and the shape of everything was delightful. We actually stayed here on two seperate days, at the beginning and end of our stay in Spain. In between, we traveled around Spain. AC Carlton was good to let us leave most of our luggage (purchases and so forth) during the time we were away in a locked room with them, for a fee. Also, of the two rooms we stayed in, the first was on a lower floor and was a bit nicer than the second one. The hotel also seemed to have lots of nice services, like international newspapers and a dining room where breakfast was served in the morning and snacks and beverages in the afternoon. All the sorts of things you would expect in a really good hotel, I suppose, but for the price (less than 100 euros/night), and considering the amount of space, I was delighted to see all these amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JimWicklow
Reviews.Content: Stayed her with my partner for 3 nights in January 2012. It is a 5 min walk around the corner from the Atocha bus station. We got the Express bus from the airport which costs €2 per person and turn left when you exit the station. From the moment we arrived the staff were excellent and most helpful. Ask about sightseeing, restaurants, etc and they will assist. Most speak very fluent English. We chose a high up room and it was very spacious. The Bed was a Queen size and was the most comfortable that I have ever slept in at any hotel. The only English channel on the TV is the BBC World service but it did not matter to us as we spent most of our time out ad about. Location meant you were about a 15 to 20 min walk to the city centre but taxis were easily available if required. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: JeffHsi
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! 1. Situated between two metro stops, one of which is only a 5 minute walk away. 2. 5 minutes from Atocha train station - perfect for daytripping and catching a train to Cordoba 3. Reina Sofia is only a 5 minute walk away (go when it's free!) 4. Other major attractions only 15-20 minute walk away. 5. Super market was only two blocks away Perks!! 1. Free Mini-bar, which was restocked every day!! This made my wife very happy. 2. FreeWifi in lobby ... eh, I wish they had this in the room, but oh well. 3. Spacious rooms! 4. Inexpensive compared to major international brands. We booked early so we saved a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Safe, Clean, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: stallion114
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a brief stop in Madrid. The location is very convenient to the Atocha metro stop which can put you at any main attraction within 8 minutes. The staff spoke very good english for those who can not speak spanish. Rooms were very clean and of good size as far as European standards. I would rank the AC carlton somewhere between a Courtyard and a Marriott in quality, but the price reflected this and made it a great value for budget conscious travelers that do not want to sacrifice safety or quality. One really nice perk is that the hotel offers both free wifi and free minibar. The minibar was not all that impressive as in only had a couple cokes, fanta, and water but it was a pleasant surprise anyway. Getting Here: You can either take the Metro from the airport for 2.50 euro or take the express bus which picks up at the airport every 20 minutes for 20 euro. The bus is quicker and does not require a train transfer but if you are buying a 24 hour pass on the metro you can save a couple euro taking the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel-quiet near train station”
Reviews.Author: casamurray
Reviews.Content: We wanted a quiet area and found it even though near train station. Very nice area and just steps from train station-we walked with our luggage. Nice museum area-all major museums within walking distance. Easy metro to major sites. Hotel room was most spacious we have ever had in Europe-huge room-contemporary decor, dark and quiet for great sleeping. And-free mini-bar! Hotel staff was most gracious and helpful. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Fun Spot”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandAnne
Reviews.Content: We stopped here some time ago - but I promised myself I'd write a review. The hotel is located in a good spot - not far from all you need. We found the restaurant in the hotel to be excellent - try the sangria ... :) I could go on my morning walks in complete safety and we never had a problem with transport. Lovely foyer and welcome. Our - room - for 3 - was large and airy with a good bathroom. It was a corner room. It was an easy walk up to the spot where many of the tourist busses departed and to many of the local eateries. Well worth thinking of if you plan to stop in Madrid. I'd go back !

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: Alisa N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our first trip to Spain last November, and being a loyal Marriott customer, stayed at this AC Hotel location and were not disappointed. We were in a suite, and I absolutely loved the room and bathroom! Each and every hotel staff member we met provided very friendly and exceptional service. After arriving from the US and not being on the same time clock, we awoke for our first morning well after the breakfast service hours were over and the kitchen was closed, but the chef volunteered to make us a wonderful breakfast and we sure appreciated it! Although the train station is very close, we took taxis almost everywhere we went and were only minutes away from Plaza Mayor, the area in which we spent most of our very short 3-day weekend. Although my husband speaks Spanish, I don't, and all of the hotel staff spoke English and were very easy to communicate with, friendly and had no troubles at all understanding me. I would definitely stay here again when in town and upgrade to the suite.... it will cost you less than many other hotels, you will still save a ton of money, get a great room and are close to many wonderful places. I will certainly stay here again when we return in a few months!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Room to Yoga in the Huge Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Caraib321
Reviews.Content: After figuring out how to buy a Metro ticket, we eventually arrived at the hotel from the airport in less than an hour. We walked about fifteen minutes out of the way. The hotel is easy to find and is situated on a nice busy main street. Many thanks to the other reviewers who gave detailed directions, which I downloaded to my phone! As a Platinum Marriott member, we got a small jar of candy as a welcome gift, but no free breakfast or afternoon appetizers. We ended up at some lively coffee shops in the residential area for breakfast (walk south of the hotel opposite the museum area). One place worth mentioning for dinner is Museo del Jamon – located near the Prada. The front is a lively crowded tapas bar, bakery and deli so you must walk to the back to get to the restaurant. We had a room facing the inside courtyard so we didn’t have a view of all the action on the street. This was just fine -- no view, no noise! By the way, you must put your room key in a key holder near the door after you enter the room to turn the lights on. This is not only good for energy, but also convenient because you never have to hunt for the room key. The room had two ultra modern black chairs and a glass table at the end of the really nice firm bed. There was a sleek desk opposite the bed and above it was a flat screen TV. Below the desk was a fully stocked mini bar and yes, just like everyone said in other reviews, they give you free soft drinks, water and beer! We stayed three days and they stocked the mini bar each day! We liked the huge bathroom see through glass double-head rainforest shower head, large separate Jacuzzi bath tub, towel warmer and plenty of space to walk around and do yoga under the dramatic ceiling spotlights. There was also about a 10 inch round magnifying mirror, which was perfect for shaving. Give me wood floors, wood closets and wood walls in a hotel any day and yes the wood made the room seem cleaner than hotels with carpet where the maid sprays that deodorizer to give the room a fresh smell. This room just smelled clean with no artificial fragrance. The hotel had great front desk staff. There were tables and a small lounge area in the lobby across from a small bar stand – something you might have in your house – a few feet from the boutique elevator, which could fit two people and two pieces of luggage or three people and no luggage at a time. Four people at a time in that elevator would be pressing it! Overall, this is a fine hotel near everything!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Cat4 Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Chakkrapong H
Reviews.Content: A tiny hotel located in shady area but next to museum avenue. Easily walk to several museums. We stayed in Dec 2011 and the hotel was recently bought by Marriott but not fully integrated. Because of our Marriott status, we got upgraded to their suite but the room was small and the heater did not work properly. No concierge lounge, no welcome gift, no complimentary breakfast and NO VIEW. Decent buffet breakfast with reasonable price. Not worth for Marriott cat4

Reviews.Title: “You've gotta stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: kellisima
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, free wifi, amazing breakfast, beautiful rooms!! The hotel is located near the main train station (Atocha) which made it really convenient to get to the hotel from the airport (we purchased a 3 day public transportation pass which was great). It's also within a couple of metro stop locations making it easy to get anywhere in Madrid. Free wifi in the lobby area or you can purchase wifi use in your room. The breakfast....okay, we always try to choose a hotel that includes a free breakfast, but I have NEVER seen a breakfast like this one!!! It was so generous and delicious and the dining room was nice (and large too so no worries about finding a place to sit). They even have an espresso/capuccino maker!! DELIGHTFUL ASSORTMENT OF FOOD AND DRINK! The room was very comfortable, nice flat screen tv, beautifully decorated. It was wonderful and quiet and we enjoyed a great nights sleep each night! The staff was very helpful. They even arranged a car for us to get to the airport the morning we were leaving. We would most definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel”
Reviews.Author: fbrito29
Reviews.Content: Hotel close to a lot of Madrid sites, staff tries to do things correctly to the guest, but too few of them to handle tourist traffic. Samall elevators make it impossible for 3 people to fit with luggage. Once in my room I complaint that it smell like cigarette, person at the counter promised to have the maid spray some scent in it, the whole stay passed and the smell remained. Front desk staff courteous, but it is impossible to tend to so many visitors with too few members

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Beverly_Mars
Reviews.Content: I went to Madrid with a friend for the weekend and since English is rarely spoken there, I had to translate everything for her. But AC's reception desk was always run by extremely kind people who spoke English! Rooms: I've never stayed at a more luxurious hotel room! There was even a small hall between the bedroom and the bathrooom! Great beds, soft pillows, bath, complimentary toiletries, hair dryer, a lot of storage room in the hall, flat screen TV in bedroom, radio. Breakfast: The breakfast was exquisite, especially the donuts... Other sweet treats include biscuits, croissants, churros (you can make a chocolate beverage yourself, since they bring to the table a pot of hot coffee and another of hot milk), cinnamon swirls, two different cakes and of course butter and marmelade (several types and in their own tiny jar). It offers a great choice of bread, cheese and cured meat. Omelette, coctail sausages, tortilla and hard boiled eggs are some of the delicacies you can try. For healthier eaters, there's always a selection of cereal, fruit, juices and cold milk. Other: They charge you for Internet connection in your room, but if you're not too impatient, you can browse the Internet free of charge in the lobby and the breakfast room, using your laptop or smartphone. All in all, I know for a fact I will definitely stay there when I revisit Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near everything you want in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Michelle D
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel made us feel welcome and special. The front desk was very knowledgable and had helpful recommendations on places to eat, sights, and directions. This hotel is close to Metro Stations, grocery stores, main rail station, museums, and some of Madrid's best restaurants. Rooms were large and very clean. The free mini bar, which included sodas and water was a special treat. The breakfast buffet was out of this world. Well worth it! It included fresh meats, cheeses, fruits, pastries, and juices. In all, this hotel was awesome. I would recommend it to anyone traveling to Madrid for business or short holiday getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Steven123
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to stay, particularly when you take into account you can get a room for as low as 60 Euros a night. The hotel is very conveniently located. If you're arriving on the Aeroexpress bus from the airport (a remarkable 2 Euros for the entire 30 minute ride), you'll arrive at Atocha station and from there it is a ten minute walk to the hotel. Also, there is a Palos de Frontera metro station less than 5 minutes by foot from the hotel. The metro is incredibly efficient, clean and only 90 Eurocents per ride if you buy a packet of 10 tickets. The hotel is compact and very clean. Good, friendly front desk people. A great lounge lobby to sit and read the many complimentary newspapers or enjoy free WIFI access. The rooms are very clean, with a wonderfully nice wooden floor, firm, but comfortable beds, nice fixtures and a great size bathroom with rainshower, big jacuzzi bathtub and many complimentary toileteries. We didn't eat in the hotel, but they have a nice size breakfast buffet for 14 Euros plus VAT per person. We had very good sleeps, although you can hear noise from other rooms or from the floor above you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTripster
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel close to the train station; while the property was built in the 50's, it has been modernized and meets current standards. Staff is very helpful with recommendations and information. Lot's of restaurants nearby and good public transportation make the major sites easy to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good situation”
Reviews.Author: member from
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not too far from Atocha station and was ideal for us as we had planned day trips form Madrid to other cities. You can also walk from the hotel to the Plaza Mayor in about 20 minutes. The Reina Sofia gallery is just round the corner. We stayed four nights and after the first night had to ask to change rooms because of the noise from the room next door - it had an adjoining door. The second room we got was ideal. Breakfast was very good and staff very welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, stylish but still good value.”
Reviews.Author: TheTaylorBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend. The room was a good size. It was very modern and stylish. The free soft drinks mini bar was a nice suprise. The bathroom was well stocked and had a good shower. The was some some slight road noise which you would expect. The location was good, slightly south of the main sights, but easy for transport. Overall very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller05
Reviews.Content: My better half and I stayed at the AC Hotel Carlton for 3 nights earlier this month (November 2011) and overall I would rate the hotel very highly. Specifics: Location: The hotel is very conveniently located near Atocha station which has at least 2 trains an hour to Madrid Barajas Airport (tickets cost €2.15 one way and journey time was about 25 mins). The walk to Atocha is less than 10 mins. The hotel is also very close to Atocha metro station and a short walk from a couple of famous museums. On the metro from Atocha, you'd only be a few stops away from Gran Via and Sol. Service: service was consistently provided with a smile. We don't speak Spanish and this wasn't a massive problem at the hotel. The hotel seemed to have a very small staff contingent (so e.g. the very efficient lady serving our omelettes also chipped into cleaning rooms). Not a complaint - More a compliment to the hard working team. Rooms: We had a standard room on the 7th floor, which overlooked the back of the hotel (and unused mini-courtyard/fire escape). So not much of a view, but the rooms were generally cleaned adequately. The standard rooms are a bit small, so if you'll be spending time in your room, you might want to upgrade. Dining: this is probably the only area where I think the hotel comes up short. The room service menu is fairly limited and almost identical to the one in the small restaurant in the lobby. We ordered to our room on our first night and were disappointed by the fact that our food was cold by the time it got to us. Quality was good nonetheless, so it's more an issue around choice. Of course, you could always eat outside the hotel, so this isn't a massive flaw. The breakfast area was well set up, with a respectable food choice. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: cosmicgirl1978
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for a few days in Madrid. It was very close to Atocha rail station and the bus which takes you straight to the airport for 2 Euros. It was also very close to a Metro station, so it felt very close to all the sights of the city. Check in was very easy and service was friendly and helpful. The lobby was small, but stylish and seemed to have had a recent makeover. We had a room on the 6th floor facing the busy street. Yes, we could hear traffic noise, but with the window shut and air conditioning on, it was not a problem at all. The room itself was large and recently renovated. The free minibar was great and a great feature of the hotel. There was lots of storage space, a good tv and a very comfortable and large king size bed. The bathroom was really good and a pleasure to use. The shower was good, but the bath itself was rather small. I can highly recommend this hotel. However, sadly it is not all praise! The soundproofing between rooms was non-existent Noise could be clearly heard from the room and bathroom next door and scraping chairs on the wooden floor upstairs woke me up several times. This is such a shame, as everything else about this hotel was fantastic!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Chrisocici37
Reviews.Content: great location, in the center of madrid. near restaurants. try the flamenco show and dinner at faena. excellent. near metro and other attractions. only bad thing is that i was able to hear our next door neighbor flushing the toilet each time. but otherwise, the room was spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dita511
Reviews.Content: The AC Carlton Hotel gives you great bang for your buck - it's highly affordable yet has well-appointed rooms with sleek decor. The location is also to die for - you are within close walking distance of the metro, the interstate Renfe trains at Atocha station (just around the corner!) and also within decent striking distance of the Buen Retiro Park, the Prado Museum (a dream if you love Spanish art), and the Reina Sofia/Thyssen-Bornemisza Galleries (also well worth a visit). The only very slight downsides were overly zealous heating and an off-putting creaking noise that was emanating from somewhere in our room occasionally while we were trying to sleep. I'm sure this was just a weird one-off phenomenon though! Overall, AC Carlton is a wonderful hotel - particularly for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: AnneMcMunn
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a Madrid city break where we stayed five nights at the AC Hotel Carlton and loved it. Our room was on the sixth floor and looked out on a fire escape and central well, so no view, but no traffic noise either. The room facilities are excellent, plenty of room, very large bathroom, modern fittings and spotlessly clean. Reception staff were friendly and helpful and the maid service cannot be faulted - everything, including the free mini-bar was replenished daily. The safe was also free as was wifi in the lobby which was a bonus. We didn't eat in the hotel, preferring to have breakfast in one of the many local cafes which offered good value for money. On the down side, there was no dressing table and the air conditioning was blowing warm air - when we asked about it, we were told it wasn't working! However, we could leave the window open as there was a full shutter on it. The location of the hotel is ideal with excellent transport links. We found that Paseo de la Frontera Metro station was the handiest, just a couple of streets down from the hotel and saved the trek through Atocha Renfe to get to the Metro part. Atocha Renfe is worth a look just for the huge tropical planting, an interesting photographic exhibition and pools with dozens of terrapins!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, helpful staff, amazing rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Lourdes C
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, well located at Paseo Las Delicias, close to Atocha station and less than 5 minutes walk to Reina Sofia museum, Paseo del Prado, Atocha station, Jardin botanico, etc. It's surrounded with nice restaurants, a wide avenue where cheap taxis are always available. The rooms are big, clean, with wide and comfortable bathrooms with free mini bar with water, beer and soft drinks wich is refill every day. The windows have shades for more privacy and there is a wide range of TV channels. Wi-Fi is free in the lobby, paid when connected in the room, but they have a nice bar in the lobby with attentive staff in most languages. The menu is discrete but extremely delicious (try the Pizza AC with Jamon Iberico). The lobby has wide tables and small ones so you can surf the web while eating with the family or alone. It's a very busy lobby in the evenings, it seems people from around go there to have a cup of wine and talk, we found it very nice, it gives some life to the place. Hop on Hop off buses are very close to the Reina Sofia and there are many restaurants with good food local and even franchises as Starbucks, Mc Donalds and others. Be aware of the spanish eating schedule so only a light selection of food will be available in the menu if you arrive after or before eating hours. At the moment there is a construction near by but it's not noisy, my room was on six floor and I have no problem sleeping all night comfortably. I highly recommend this hotel and I'll stay there again in my futures trips to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to everything!”
Reviews.Author: TheAnswer
Reviews.Content: The AC Carlton is an awesome value considering all its comforts and conveniences at a very affordable price. The room is clean, modern, and cozy. It comes complete with flat screen LCD TV, fridge, digital safe, and plenty of outlets for charging all your gadgets. The bathroom is beautifully appointed and generously stocked with toiletries. I got a kick out of the built in audio system! What really makes the AC Carlton shine is its fantastic location. Just start walking and within minutes you are at various attractions such as Reina Sofia, Caixa Forum, Museo del Prado, Real Jardin Botanico, and Parque del Retiro -- just to name a few. Itching to venture out a little further? The Atocha metro station is 10 min from the hotel. Take the blue line to catch other lines. You can go to and from Barajas airport this way. Trains to other cities such as Toledo and Segovia also depart from Atocha. There is a restaurant on site. Free wi-fi in the lobby. As of November 2010 prices, this can all be had for €89 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KAZIBEAR
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic trip to Madrid! The Hotel Carlton was excellent, very clean and the free soft drinks minibar was a lovely gesture. The people on the reception were ok not very chatty but very efficient. Great location for the metro and the museums the area itself was not the nicest but a short walk up the hill and you are in heaven! The only tip I would give you is brush up on your spanish! My husband asked for the bill and they brought a tea! also if you eat/drink on the main areas it can be expensive

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Patrick013
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a weekend. Lovely room ,friendly staff , walking distance to main museums & 3 minutes from Metro station meant easy access anywhere in city. Great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MichaelDrake
Reviews.Content: Decent location with two subway stations about 5 mins walk away. This hotel is linked to the Marriott but is definitely not Marriott standard. The front desk staff were fine although there was always only one of them on duty which meant people had to wait most times at reception. Did not decide to have breakfast (about Euro 14) as we went down the road for a croissant and tea breakfast for 2 or 3 Euros) Mini Bar was free which is nice although to be honest we never used it once - not too sure why not but just didn't get around to it. FYI - Museums are closed on Monday. We made this mistake and did not get to see them!

Reviews.Title: “Madrid trip”
Reviews.Author: notpink
Reviews.Content: Hotel in very good location. Near Atocha rail and underground and close to Reina Sophia gallery (Picasso's Guernika painting) and within ten mins walk of brilliant Prado. We asked for quiet non smoking room and got one on 6th floor which was fine. There is road noise as this is a city but didnt find too intrusive. Room was fine with free soft drinks in mini bar. Good breakfast included in price and staff were helpful. We travelled from airport on metro which was easy but there is a bus which we didnt find. Would stay here again if in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Wait until Marriott retrains the staff”
Reviews.Author: chinapoblana
Reviews.Content: Generally, everything was OK except the desk staff. Had it not been for them, I would have given this place an excellent rating. However, the staff brings it down. As usual, in any hotel we can have obnoxious neighbors. I was in a sound afternoon sleep when I heard a neighbor check in. Right away, he aggressively started moving furniture and then started screaming into his cell phone to the point the walls were shaking. This is shocking, as the place is rather well insulated noise wise. The guest services manual was rather disorganized. I could not find an extension for reception. Therefore, I got dressed, went down and reported the incident. After I gave her the room number in questions, she said, "He is a regular and one of our most important clients." I had been speaking in English. Then I switched to my fluent Mexican Spanish, telling her that I heard and understood every word of his cell phone conversation. If the hotel does not do anything to correct him, then I will. That and my Spanish really scared her and I had no further questions. However, I was left with two bad impressions. Some guests, the regulars, count more than myself. The regulars are nuts and the hotel tolerates this unless you intimidate them like I did. The place is understaffed. When I checked out and needed a taxi to Chamartin strain station, the desk clerk tossed me and my luggage out on the corner and said that taxis pass by all the time and would automatically stop if they saw my luggage. Well, I was there for several minutes while cabs passed me by that I did not hail in time. Finally, I grabbed one. Also, the desk staff is very argumentative and arrogant. When I asked about getting a taxi to Chamartin train station, she insisted I use the connecting train from Atocha, the Cercanias. I told her I had already used it and liked it, but with a suitcase and a backpack that would not work. She continued to argue, telling me that at Chamartin there were services to carry luggage. There was no such thing. She was avoiding the issue. Finally, she snapped, "Well, if you prefer a taxi, by all means take one." So I was tossed out on the corner. I'm tossing this hotel out. I hope Marriot, who bought the chain will retrain the staff, but I do not plan to return to find out

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located nice city hotel”
Reviews.Author: janbnl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the facade and the lobby of the hotel looked quite out-dated. However the person behind the reception desk was kind and accomodating. The hotel bar was closed (arrival 00.30 hrs) and he pointed me to a nearby bar for my nightcap. The single room on the 7th floor was apparently recently refurbished in a nice modern and efficient style. All amenities were present. The biggest advantage from this hotel was that the location is on an easy distance from the Atocha train station (and underground), les then 5 minutes by foot. Another remarkable aspect was the breakfast that was included in my modest price. Not that it was so extravagant, but the produce they used was excellent, everything was good quality. The ham and other cold cuts were iberico, what can't be said of most hotels, great breads etc. etc. Really a joyfull start of the day if you can have a breakfast with real and not fake spanish ingredients. I was quite happy after my one night stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Bit hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Peps112
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Modern hotel in good location near Atocha rail station. We were allocated a smoking room, despite requesting a no smoking room. Maintenance/housekeeping not great. Air conditioning was broken. When we turned on the air conditioning unit smoke billowed out of unit and awful smell of burning. Had to be quite firm about moving to another room. This room looked clean until you looked a little closer! Not sure we would stay here again. PR

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: mini_doll
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel at a great price. It is centrally located, close the train station, museums and the metro. The mini bar was free. Spacious room with a nice flat screen. The staff was very friendly. Can pay for wi-fi n the room. I defintiely recommend this hotel if you're visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PetaMay
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. Friendly staff. Free Wi-Fi in foyer which also has a lovely Bar. Breakfast was a little over-priced but a good selection. Location is excellent. Easy to find for a beginner in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “good location for a short stay near Atocha Station”
Reviews.Author: weeyintoronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of May. For the money it was a perfect hotel. We were coming in by train from malaga on day 1. Day 2 we were doing a train trip to Toledo from the same station. Day 3 we had an early flight to the airport. It is easily walkable from the Atocha train station even with luggage( 10 mins). If we had actually come out of the correct exit it would have been an easy walk to the hotel. Unfortunately we exited on the furthest side of the station. We didn't make that mistake the 2nd time. There are lots of cabs at the station and they seemed to charge an extra supplement from this location. The rooms were clean and modern however one of them did smell of smoke although we had requested all non smoking. They did quickly change it. My rate included an extensive buffet breakfast with very good Nespresso machines. They actually made a decent Cappuccino. The small lobby was always busy as it had free wifi and lots of seating. There was a large group of teens doing a Spanish course staying there at the time. I did notice a bit of noice from them filtering up into the rooms. If staying there ask to be away from the elevators and you won't notice the lobby noise. The Prado and other major Museums were about a 15 mins stroll. However to get to the centre of Madrid I would take a cab for 3 or 4 or subway if on your own. The area directly in front of the hotel has at slightly scuzzy feel as you got closer to the station. Towards the museums felt much more upmarket. We were 6 and walking in a group felt safe where ever we went. If you will be using the train a lot it's a great location. Also in the summer its nice to walk in the park and it was close by. If not I would probably stay a bit more central. For eating don't even think of dining before 9p. We found a great Italian about a 15 mins stroll and went back twice. We had to sit outside until they opened at 9pm and only the outside table were busy . By the time we left, inside also had customers. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and arranged a van to take us to the airport early in the morning. Overall a good hotel for the money for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would come back here!”
Reviews.Author: diana_21
Reviews.Content: Although a lot of reviews say this is not in the centre of Madrid, it's hardly out of the way. You are a 5 minute walk from Atocha metro station, and 3 stops and you're in the centre. It is also great for going to and from the airport. It is also literally a 5 minute walk to the hotel from Atocha Train station. The Airport Express drops you off at Atocha train station from the airport for €2. Also, a short walk from Retiro Park and a walk also El Prado. The rooms were very clean, modern and spacious. The hotel staff friendly and helpful. Would come back here if I were ever to the have the luck of coming back to Madrid. Internet is free in the lobby, and complimentary non alcoholic drinks in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Miguel P
Reviews.Content: Positive: Location - Very close to two metro stations on different lines, which provides unprecedented mobility. Near the Atocha train station and the main museums in Madrid. Comfort - beautiful rooms, comfortable and clean. Negative: Services - the lobby of the hotel is too small. 4 tables for the bar (which incredibly close to 23h) and four tables to access the Internet is very little. Is this same lobby which is placed a television that is also off to 23h.
