Reviews.Title: “Crisp clean fresh and great base”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumNZ
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a good location that met almost all my needs. The only thing its needs is free wifi throughout the hotel rather than just in the lobby. But this this aside, the room and hotel in general is very clean and provides a very good quality of accommodation. Good sized bed with quality sheeting, modern spacious bathroom, and excellent air conditioning which is essential in the summer months. The hotel feels quite homely with guests often sitting together in the lobby lounge area using internet. It is quite close to the metro so easy to access cheap transport to the airport. If you are staying a few days, then it is definitely worth buying the 5 day tourist public transport travel pass. The pass avoids having to pay the 1 euro airport access fee, and you can use the trains (Renfe) which are quicker and more comfortable to get around the city. The Renfe also connects easier to the airport. Check the metro map for the connection point for the Renfe to get to the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel as a comfortable base.

Reviews.Title: “Free Minibar? Nice touch!”
Reviews.Author: TnTSan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in July 2011 and found the location to be fabulous for the price. We were able to walk easily to many places. The Prado de San Sebastian train station is literally two blocks down the street. We walked to all of the Museums and the Cervantes area which had some decent restaurants. There was a great little cafe across the street from the hotel entrance which proved to be a great breakfast spot and the room itself was very comfortable. My only complaints with the hotel are the $15/day internet charge (you can use it for free in the lobby) and that the bathtub was not even large enough for me to sit with my legs straight. As a fairly short person, this was a little obnoxious. Though it is printed in all of the promotional literature in the room, guest book, info book, etc... without reading this, I would not have known about the complimentary mini-bar. There were waters and sodas, which was nice, and we used the mini bar fridge to store a couple bottles of wine that we picked up from the grocery store down the street. Overall, it was a very good hotel and I would recommend it to travelers on a mid-range budget or to business travelers for its easy access to the train station and public transportation. (2 blocks from 2 different metro stops).

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, ok location”
Reviews.Author: peefster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton for 2 nights in July. We had taken the aerobus from the airport to atocha station which is about a 5-7min walk away. Initial thoughts were that the surrounding area looked a bit run down but we had no issues during our stay. The rooms are quite comfortable with my personal highlight being the large bathrooms with a rain shower provided. The breakfast buffet was another highlight. No wifi in the rooms but it was free in the lobby which is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Front Desk/Office Staff”
Reviews.Author: lionel86
Reviews.Content: 1.) The office staff that morning was absolutely horrible and very rude. She would not let use the hotel phone to make a few phone calls after we had some trouble with our passports. She continually pointed us to the public pay phone but the payphones did not even work. We wasted nearly 6 Euros and she then rudely told us to use the room phone even when we asked for help since our passports were in limbo. 2.) The elevator was broken for half the day so imagine carrying your luggage up 7 floors....exactly. 3.) No wi-fi except the lobby so you have to come all the way down every time to use your computer/Iphone. The location is nice and the hotel is clean but after the encounter with the front desk staff, it just made my stay weird and I would not recommend coming back or staying there.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BUSINESS Hotel in Madrid for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bizness-man11
Reviews.Content: For the value, this is the most spacious room I have had in Madrid if not Europe for the price. There is a desk, a large bed and the bathroom is magnificent. I am a business traveler, who likes to watch my budget but needs certain amenities. There is paid for WiFi in the rooms which works great and free in the lobby. As a business hotel, for the price, this is better than the Intercontinental. There is no Gym though. I'd HIGHLY recommend the hotel and the staff is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Cerys-Anna
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the hotel, and were very satisfied with all aspects, including the price, which was very reasonable for a 4* city centre hotel. Situated close to Atocha station, drop off point for the airport bus as well as the Metro and with Reina Sophia just up the road it was very convenient. Cool and welcoming – Madrid was very hot – the receptionist spoke excellent English and was happy to help us with queries. The free mini bar – water and soft drinks- was very welcome. The tv was huge, the bed comfy, the shower impressive and the towels fat and fluffy. The only minor snag was the price of breakfast – an eye watering 14 euros + tax ! It was no doubt a superb buffet, but there are lots of little cafes nearby serving a simple meal for 3 , so we stuck with that. No problem with noise – although the hotel was full. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST staff anywhere in Spain”
Reviews.Author: Cledra
Reviews.Content: We an easy walk from the train station to the hotel. The Manager on the front desk was delightful. He spoke excellent English as did the lady the next day. He recommended places to eat and things to see. The hotel was clean and unlike some of the others we stayed at did NOT smell of sewerage. I would stay there again. Only one down side, the pillows were hard and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: Grant_UK
Reviews.Content: I've given it a 5 for location but it really depends on what you want. We needed to be near Atocha so for us it was great. If you are in Madrid for the sights then it's fine but you'll be using the metro. Check in was slightly confusing as they claimed not to have our reservation though it was found surprisingly quickly when we produced a print out. All handled very politely though. Rooms are generous in size and very clean. Excellent addition of typical Spanish residential style blackout blinds ensure a good sleep and we had no issue with noise. Minor irritations - no tea/coffee making facilities and the safe though there needed a key from reception rather than being a keypad. Biggest annoyance was the hot water pressure which meant the shower was difficult to manage. Overall excellent location for us, really clean, really good sized and excellent value for money for a European capital (you would pay around £100/€100 euro a night MORE for this in London for example)

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque_NMGeezer
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based largely on Tripadvisor reviews so much is just a repeat but it was actually nicer than we expected. We arrived quite early but the room was ready and we were allowed to check in. We had a little difficulty finding it after arriving at the Atocha station but that was my fault for not printing out the Google map-it is not as close as a glance at said map appears. We found out that when you need directions in Madrid the Police are very helpful. Room was fairly large, very clean and recently remodeled. Breakfast was excellent. It is not a long walk into the central city and great restaurants but the few we found within a couple blocks of the hotel were pretty awful. We stopped looking and probably missed something. We took the but from the airport to Atocha which was convenient, but a word of warning. We had one attempted luggage theft at the airport and a very obvious pickpocket got on the bus to follow us. We made it clear that he had been spotted and he ran at Atocha. This combined with three failed pickpocketing attempts on the Barcelona metro showed us that the rumors about Madrid and Barcelona are real. Stay alert and ready to confront.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: gcohen905
Reviews.Content: The AC Carlton is an excellent choice for a moderately priced hotel in Madrid. Although the property is not in one of the more exclusive areas of Madrid, it is conveniently located, just a couple of blocks from Atocha (the train station) and in walking distance to many other areas, including Gran Via, Plaza de Sol, and Retiro Park. The rooms are modern and very clean, as are the common areas in the hotel. The breakfast buffet offered a nice selection and the staff were friendly and courteous. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for seeing Madrid”
Reviews.Author: journeymancannes
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Clean, modern, friendly and helpful staff. I read other reviews mentioning lovely spacious rooms. Mine was small and very basic..felt more like a hostel, quite bare with very little comfort and the sound system would NEVER turn off completely. And charging for wi-fi in rooms is like charging for running water...please stop it! Maybe a different room would have changed my opinion, so next time I will try another but there WILL be a next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 2 times”
Reviews.Author: love2travel508
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two times (May 2008 and March 2010). The rooms were great: clean, spacious and recently remodeled. The staff is friendly and helpful. Location is good, but it is not right in the center of town or near the night life. However it is steps away from the Atocha (train station) and Reina Sofia (museum). For the price it’s a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: PetrinaPompano
Reviews.Content: what a relief - great hotel - free wifi in lobby as it's pricy in the rooms. nice and close to metro and main train station. wall very thin - could hear phones in the next room going off at 3am. But overall, hotel was very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for the price/ Depressing Location but close to train station”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Around87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago (TA wouldn't let me pick a date far back enough?). Great room! One of the most spacious I have had in Europe. Especially loved the bathroom with it's very modern updates (great for the price range). Biggest downside for us was that the location around the hotel was downright depressing. This was our first city in Spain and there was nothing charming about this area but getting into the nicer historic parts of the city was not hard by metro. The lady at the front desk was helpful in giving us directions. They charge for Wifi in the rooms if I remember correctly but if you walk to the McD's down the street and buy anything you get a free half hour. We did this at McD's all over Spain (a lot of sundaes and fries!) And (this may not be the case anymore but a few years ago) the lobby had this weird hair salon/perm smell to it that was sickening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindadavrath
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this AC hotel in Madrid. The room, although fairly small was clean and pleasant, and the big bathroom created a feeling of spaciousness. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the Atoche Ave station and metro so very convenient if you need to travel to other locations in Spain. Staff were pleasant and helpful and I loved the breakfast and excellent coffee! Free in room minibar is a nice touch. Finally, it is a 10 min walk to the Park del Buen Retiro, a great location for a run or people watching. As a woman traveling alone, I also felt comfortable returning to the hotel at 11 pm. I'll definitely stay at an AC hotel during my next business trip to Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: biloon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights. We really enjoyed this hotel. It was in a great location. We were able to walk to most places otherwise catching a cab outside was very easy. Also, to note, cabs are very affordable in this city. Our room was a good size, clean and modern in design. We loved the free beverages in our minibar. And we enjoyed going down to the lobby every night to use the free internet, have a couple drinks and a cheese plate before going out on the town. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid - the Center of it All”
Reviews.Author: rudeman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally steps away from the Atocha train station so if coming to Madrid by train (as we did), this is ideal. In addition, the triumvirate of museums is within 15 minutes walking distance. Access to the hop-on, hop-off bus is nearby and there are plenty of restaurants in the area. In addition, it's central location was good for walking even to the Grand Via, Sol, and Plaza Mayor. The desk clerks were good to very good. The elevators were typical European elevators (small) but worked well. Our room was ver good and the bathroom was excellent. Bed was comfortable. Room was a little warm until we figured out the thermostat. We had the breakfast buffet on the last day (we usually prefer hitting the little restaurants in the city). A little pricey but there was an excellent selection and everything we had was very good. When we return to Madrid, this hotel will be very high on our list.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Michelexyz
Reviews.Content: Went there with my father, perfect place to stay. Excellent value for money, 10 minutes away from tube station, clean and spacious, kind staff (they don't speak much English but as I speak italian there was no problem)

Reviews.Title: “suggestions for travelers”
Reviews.Author: barneysim
Reviews.Content: agree on the usual comments with earlier reviews. a few thoughts: - great wifi connection in lobby. have to pay 15 euros for 24 hour access from room, so we stuck with lobby internet connection - our room only 75 euros per night, a great price for a nice clean hotel. - location good and bad. convenient in terms of proximity to atocha train station (<5 min walk from station). however at the same time it is near a train station, so the area not the nicest (ie. wouldn't go walking around back streets late at night) - this was our last day before returning home via airport; when we approached front desk for suggestions on how to get to airport, they gave us only 2: take atocha train (not the easiest with heavy luggage plus no direct train ride at this time) or take a taxi, which they insisted would cost at most 35 euros by meter; we have a better option, which is to use an airport shuttle service called Aerocity; website is aerocity.es; we came across this option when we first flew into the madrid airport at the beginning of our trip; on the way home, i contacted this company thru an email sent to their website (for some reason the link to do an online booking wasn't working); i provided details as to how many people travelling, how many big pieces of luggage, the date/time required, and whether we wanted a direct (ie express service) ride to airport or a non-direct (up to 3 hotel pickups); our total price was 23 euros for the two of us, and as luck turned out there were no other stops (it would've cost 41 euros for an express service booking); the ride took about 45 mins as it was morning rush hour ... 9am pickup); for some reason as i said before the hotel will not mention the airport shuttle at all, not sure why not - when i said i needed access to the business center they asked for what purpose; i told them it was to print out boarding passes; not sure whether business center exists or not, but they suggested that i email them the boarding passes and they can print them out, which they did; not that this isn't so easy to do for the non-computer-literate; i managed to convert the boarding passes into a pdf format which they kindly printed out for me

Reviews.Title: “Make this your last choice”
Reviews.Author: kateknox
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at this hotel, but only stayed one as it was pretty awful, especially at 100 Euros! PROS: - Close to train station -Walkable to center CONS: -So loud. Despite being on the top floor, we could not sleep to save our lives. There was a lot of road noise, but the worst part was hearing everything happening in the other rooms on the floor. I know that hotels can't really control who is staying there or how loud they are, but this was not the problem. The problem is that we could hear EVERYTHING going on in other roooms, and most of it was everyday stuff (opening and closing doors, using the restroom/shower, having conversations, etc.). This was not a case of bad neighbors, this was a case of zero insulation. -Service left a lot to be desired. We were checked in promptly, but things went down hill from there. I asked for a map, and the person working at the desk basically threw a map at me. I asked them to show me where we were, and they had a trainee with very little English proficiency show me. She was sweet and tried her best, but I was annoyed that the more senior staff didn't step in when they saw us all struggling. -Neighborhood is a little gritty. I wouldn't want to walk home alone after dark. It is also a bit of a hike to the center.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: ant0shka
Reviews.Content: we had 3 nights in madrid and chose this hotel because its close to atocha train station and the museums. hotel is 10 minute walk to all of them. clean and moderate rooms for euro standards. very affordable, 3 nights were around 250 eu, or 300 some dollars, great deal for madrid. It seemed like it was a business hotel, because many people were in the lobby on the wifi. they offer breakfast for 15 eu, but seriously, you get breakfast for 3 eu outside so dont bother eating in.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel 5 mins from the metro”
Reviews.Author: brendan75
Reviews.Content: the room was nice and comfortable.bathroom had a very good shower.only 2 english speaking channels on the tv,the mini bar was free which was a good extra although it was just for soft drinks.there was free wi fi in the lobby but not in your room,they charged for the wi fi in your room which is expensive.breakfast was very good for a european hotel.overall a fine hotel which could do better....

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean modern hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Maguire37
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on a city break to Madrid. It is very conveniently situated about 5 mins walk from the Metro, and most of the museums are 5 to 10 mins walk away also. The El Retiro park is close by too which is definately worth a stroll through on a nice sunny day. And even Grande Via and Sol are within walking distance if you didnt want to take the metro - about 15/20 mins walk away. Our room was clean and tidy with plenty of wardrobe space, a wall mounted tv (with only bbc and cnn as english speaking channels), free softdrink minibar, and a spacious modern bathroom. Unfortunately our room had no view whatsoever as our window was facing another wall of the building and we were up on the 5th floor so couldnt really see down or up! Which was not so good when we wanted to check out what the weather was like in the mornings! Also our room was located next to an "office" which basically was the cleaning cupboard so a lot of noise came from there quite early in the mornings. The staff were so so, not very eager to help but sufficient enough. When we asked at reception on our first nite, could they tell us if there were any restaurants around we were told no they couldnt think of any! So we had to ask them to at least point us in the direction where there could possibly be some!! All in all though a good hotel which I would recommend to anyone visiting the city on a weekend break and who doesnt want to be slap bang in the middle of the busy Sol area.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need”
Reviews.Author: wart1
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Carlton, our return being recommendation enough in itself. The location is great, very close to some of the museums, and for anything further afield the excellent Madrid Metro/Atocha Station is on the doorstep if you don't want to walk and thereby soak up the atmosphere of one of our favourite cities in my favourite country. The staff are helpful and friendly enough. I would rather that than something insincerely ingratiating. If you are staying on a B & B basis the breakfasts are great value. If you fancy a bite to eat elsewhere there is a great little place just up the road with tables on the pavement. The rooms are maybe a bit characterless but perfectly adequate, comfortable and well equipped, with a decent en suite and effective, unobtrusive air conditioning, which you do need as traffic noise would preclude sleeping with the windows open. My wife and I not only WOULD go back, we WILL go back when fortunate enough to be able to return to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Close to train, located in a residential area, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: blessed16
Reviews.Content: Location: I enjoyed staying at the AC Colon. The only hang-up is that it is a 20-25 minute walk to all the touristy sites. However, it is a five minute walk to the train station, both the long distance and the local train. It is also a five minute walk to the Museo de Reina Sofia and Parque del Retiro. Due to the fact that it is located in a residential area there are several restaurants and a supermarket next door. Both my husband and I felt very safe in the area. It very easy to get to this hotel from the airport using the Metro. Great location for day trips to Toledo, Segovia, El Escorial and others. Hotel: complimentary mini bar which was restocked on a daily basis. There was also complimentary wi-fi in the hotel lobby. The hotel is very modern looking and very clean. The bathroom was a great size and pristine. The service was okay, individuals at the front desk were a bit rude.

Reviews.Title: “Tight Spaces Made Tighter”
Reviews.Author: monkeyface09
Reviews.Content: Within easy walking distance to the train station, AC Carlton offers convenience and upgraded comfort at a reasonable price. However, in an attempt to modernize the hotel, space seems to have been sacrificed for design. Besides the dark decor throughout, the oversized closet shrinks an already tiny room and an overly complicated shower system makes a small tub even smaller. While some would appreciate the bathroom radio, I would gladly give that up for more counter space. Walls are also super thin, making the extra sliding door a necessary addition. But upgrades unfortunately did not extend to the room safe, which still requires a key from the front desk. Design flaws and medieval remnants aside, the hotel is close to some of the best art museums in the city, as well as many key amenities including the metro, an internet cafe, and two supermarkets.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 3 days and didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: tsgil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 3 days and could not have been happier. The room and bathroom are spacious with every modern amenity/convenience, the free minibar is fantastic (water and soda were great perks and replenished every day) and the free WiFi in the lobby is a huge plus along with a nice bar with big drinks and super low prices. Front Desk staff was very friendly and spoke English very well. I think this is a great spot because it's in a small neighborhood so you get a real taste for Madrid. Even though it's a bit tucked away, you are a minute's walk from restaurants, bars, Reina Sofia, Atocha train station and within 15 minutes walk of the Prado. Can't wait until I stay at another AC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it, this one is a good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Eldik
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel… I usually have a lot of small things that bother me when I stay in hotels but this time I couldn’t find any. This is not a 5 star hotel, the service wasn’t out of the ordinary, no pool and no fitness center and yet it is a relaxed hotel with well decorated and equipped rooms that makes you feel comfertable. The standard room that I got was modern, clean and a bit larger than most standard hotel rooms. It had wooden parquet, 40” LCD TV (All the channels are Spanish though) and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was big and had all the necessary amenities (Well… except for hair conditioner). Something that I liked best was the fact that you can close the window shades in order to have complete darkness. This is VERY important to me since I cannot fall asleep when there is a little day light coming inside the room. In most hotels you have curtains that doesn’t really block the daylight – here you are safe :-) The breakfast buffet is simple yet enough. The lobby is small and functional, you can use it for free WiFi – Inside the room it will cost you… The hotel is located in an area where you can find many places to buy something quick to eat or find a proper restaurant in the near area. Go for it, this one is a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, situated in a convenient area and with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: otomanos
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situeted just off a main avenue and near the major museums of Madrid (Queen Sophia, Thyssen Bornemisza, and Prado). The price is very good. The rooms are quiet and of good size, immaculately clean and the bathroom is large and nice with a very good shower and a tub. The staff at the front desk are very helpful and try to be of use all the time. Breakfast has to be paid apart and it is expensive. Another minus is the expensive "business center" with two computers and costing 1 euro each 10 minutes! What would be free WIFI at the lounge did not work with my phonebook! If one needs a good hotel near the cultural center of Madrid, especially museums, who needs a helpful serene staff at the front desk to help you to get about and who is not demanding as far as a free internet or is not worried about the price breakfast is offered, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a business hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: owcprleah
Reviews.Content: Hotel Carlton AC is a great value in a business hotel. Close to Atocha and Parque del Retiros, it's very comfortable with all the amenities. I like moving into hotels like this....

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: JustS24
Reviews.Content: Carlton Hotel was conveniently located near the Atoche train station and within walking distance to the Prado and Retiro park and a block from an Opencor as well as across the street from a delicious bakery! The staff was helpful and welcoming. The rooms were clean and well cared for, and for a European city, very roomy. There was an A/C unit in each room but the windows open as well. All in all, a great value and a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Top value!”
Reviews.Author: romeriboell
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel, We were traveling in two couples. My husband and I really liked the hotel so did his sister and her husband. It is very well located, very close to Atocha station and Reina Sofia. A short walk to Prado Museum. The hotel is clean, safe and modern. Nice room, bathroom, TV and decor. We had breakfast at the hotel and it was really good, room service was also good. People at front desk were OK, not really warm, but OK. This hotel was for sure the right choice to discover the lovely Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel if only it was closer to town”
Reviews.Author: BlueLagoon99
Reviews.Content: Upside - Very close to museum Reina Sofia and Atocha-AVE train to Toledo, free WIFI but only in the lounge area downstairs. Reasonable walking to town centre (plaza mayor) but still a good 15 mins walk but have to say we didnt use the subway. Some cheap eating places around the hotel. Area has a feel good, did not feel intimated or unsafe at any point of our stay there. Reception service was good. Downside - The location, Breakfast a bit expensive we opted to eat out there were plenty of eateries around the area that offer reasonable meals. We asked for a quiet room and we got a quiet room facing inside the building with indirect light. We could hear someone next door on the phone talking in length 2 nights in a row but they stopped early enough and did not intrude into our sleep. Bathroom was good condition. Lifts are tiny, only fit 2 persons with medium bags but there are 2 lifts and both operating well and was not an inconvenience . Only drawback is it is still a bit of a walk into the plaza areas although it is a gentle slope into town. We would choose somewhere closer next time and would stay in this hotel only if the price is too good to refuse.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MeghaB
Reviews.Content: AC Carlton was a good choice! The bathrooms are great - probably one of the best ones in Europe. Location is good - a little walk from the subway line which we didnt mind. Very clean and trendy hotel. Only let down was front desk, when we arrived, in the middle of check in he answered the phone and started talking for a while as we stood and waiting... But someone else finished our check in for us. Regardless, great pick and would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in an okay location but reception staff really let them down”
Reviews.Author: 7leafClover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AC Carlton for the first May long weekend and think we got a reasonable deal on our stay. We check in at about 11:30pm and the man at the reception seemed more security guard than reception with no mention of breakfast/location/maps... or anything rather than where the lifts were. Our room was great very roomy, spotless and free mini bar so was a very pleasant surprise. It had about 10 non alcoholic drinks in there with water and lots of fizzies so great for hot spanish weather. On our third night, we went back into the hotel room to find the key would not switch on the lights, this followed with 30mins of standing around with our phones as torches while reception sent the housekeeping lady ( who was lovely but did not speak english) to try all different methods to get the light to work. They finally gave up and moved us to another room but with no torches I had to pack the things in our room in the dark with only the mobile phone torch to see. I assume we were upgraded as the next bedroom was larger and again very clean and lovely standard. However there was no apology from staff ( or offer of free breakfast which you normally get) and on checkout the guy rather accusingly said " did you change rooms" to which I gave him the reason why we had to change. Location wise - check the map property as arriving at night can be confusing and best to stay on main roads. It is close to Atocha which i believe is a main hub for train travel to other parts of spain, but if you are just travelling around Madrid is is about a 20min walk to the main tourist sites. Our room rate did not include breakfast and it seemed expensive so we cannot comment on it. I cant remember the price, but remember thinking that it was too expensive and eating out would be better. Would recommend if you are staying in madrid for a day then moving on by train, but not for exploring madrid

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with asperations, but inability to acheive them”
Reviews.Author: TioP
Reviews.Content: Hotel Carlton (recently purchased by the AC chain) tries hard to be a nice hotel, but unfortunately fails on a number of points. We booked (and paid in advance to get a special rate) months ahead, confirming at that time we would have a large bed rather than two pushed together. I confirmed that by email two weeks before our arrival, but when we got there there were only twins available. Rooms are nicely decorated and relatively large, but extremely hot and noisy; AC not turned on yet for the season. Also no insulation between rooms; we were able to follow our neighbors' conversations and time their showers with no problem. Hotel was able to move us to a new room after 4 nights, but I had to go down to the front desk at 7am to make it happen - it would never have occurred to them to handle without prodding. New room had large bed, but it was the most amazingly hard mattress we have ever experienced - absolutely impossible. Asked staff if there were any other options - told no, all the mattresses are like that. Finally gave up and switched hotels; even sacrificing prepaid portion, it was worth it. On the plus side, the breakfast was good, although a few days into our stay they started doing construction in the dining room and had to move us to the basement; staff friendly, just not competent. Convenient for Atocha, but there are many other choices - hotel on very busy street with no charm at all. Would not stay again, and will be wary of AC chain hotels in general.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: amckOxford
Reviews.Content: I booked the AC Carlton for an overnight in Madrid as I started my long overland trip home when all planes were gounded because of volcanic ash. AC Carlton is quite close to the Atocha station (so taxi drivers are a bit disgruntled by the short trip) on a main street. I wasn't in the best of moods after being stuck in Malaga for 4 days and queueing for 3 hour for the train ticket and left Malaga at 7am and arrived at 10am and checked in hoping that I could sit somewhere quiet while my room was prepared. I was delighted to find out that my room was ready and also that the buffet breakfast was available until 11am. Breakfast was great, lots of choice and lots left. even towards the end of service: fruit, cold meats, smoked salmon, omelette, cooked breaffast, pastries, Nespresso coffee - yum. On to the room. Well it wasn't huge but certainly acceptable for a city centre hotel. Free mini bar (soft drinks), stylish bathroom, desk, double bed, free WIFI (good signal) TV with BBC world and CNN. Good double glazing made even my street-facing room acceptably quiet. On the down side there were no room - specific information in there other than a room service menu (without the number to ring) Nor was there a number for reception. Also there was "ambient" music playing in the corridor outside so loudly that it was intolerable inside the room with the door shut. Time for a visit to reception... I went down expecting a fight. However the reception staff couldn't have been more helpful. The receptionist apologised for the lack of room info, it was at the printers for a reprint. She turned the music off immediately (and it didnt come back on) and she sent a guy up to my room to demo the TV who was there a minute after I got back up there! Room service food was good and delivered as requested, very quickly. My only gripe is that wine was available by the glass or a whole bottle; no half bottles. Also AC if a bit hit and miss but in April it wasn't an issue. These are relatively small gripes, I'd stay here again. It's good value at 100 euro per night (plus taxes, room only). The centre of town is about a mile and a half away, a nice walk actually.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not central”
Reviews.Author: trip_too_far
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a superior room on the second floor. Overall ok but would have preferred a hotel more in the centre (Gran Via etc). The staff could have been more attentive when approached rather then wanting to deal with you as quickly as possible (with one exception). However, all speak good English. The area is ok but a little rundown. Perfectly safe though. Pros Tea facility in superior room Big bathroom/toilet Nice selection of non-branded toiletteries in the bathroom. Complimentary mini-bar which is replenished (yes really!) OpenCor supermarket is about a one walk away Five minute walk to Atocha railway station Bus stop opposite hotel takes you past Prado and beyond. Cons Wifi in room costs about €17 for 24 hours, free in the lobby. Two small lifts make it difficult to take luggage up No lock on bathroom (by design not accident) Breakfast is too expensive at €14 per person but is filling with a choice of hot and cold food. Limited choice of English language channels (CNN and BBC World) Avoid evening meal which is served in lobby not restaurant (where you have breakfast only) There is a shop called "Sexyland" almost directly opposite the hotel (see my photo). Don't know what the shop sells but can guess.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal in a Good Location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: chibearbob
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the AC Carlton in late March and early April of 2010 in two separate stays. The first stay was for 2 nights and I prepaid through Hotels.com. I paid about $100 a night and it was supposed to be a triple. I thought that was awfully cheap but when I got to the hotel I found out why. The room was ready and it was a triple but I had to pay another 30 euros a night for the third person. I assume hotels.com messed up. The other 4 nights I stayed I paid about $180 a night. That was a cancelable rate. We stayed in room 201 both times. The room faces Delicias street and there is some noise from the traffic. It is a 3 or 4 lane street. However, the windows are pretty substantial and none of our sleep was interrupted. The room was good size by European standards and the bathroom was very nice. In addition to the two beds and rollaway bed, there were 2 chairs and a small table. We had a small refrigerator in the room. The hotel is about 3 blocks from Atocha train station and is in a good area of Madrid. It is about 4 blocks from Reina-Sofia and 6 blocks from the Prado. There are many banks with ATM machines on the block. There are several small stores (super mercados) where you can buy food and drink. There are plenty of restaurants of all kinds within walking distance. It is not very far from the Heurta entertainment area that is very popular. It is about 4 blocks from the Atocha Metro (not Atocha Reinfe) stop. The staff speaks pretty good English. The room had a big screen TV (37-40 inches) and had three English language stations (BBC, CNN & CNBC). There are two computers in the lobby that cost 1 euro for every ten minutes. A printer is connected and is free to use. There is a restaurant that serves food in the lobby as well as a lobby bar. We did not eat there but it was busy at times. We had drinks at night in the lobby. House wine is about 3.50 euros. The lobby bar closes at 11:30PM. There is a television in the lobby. The AC Carleton is a nice 4 star hotel (per hotels.com) that has reasonable rates in a good location in Madrid. It is eight stories high and has 122 rooms. There are two elevators that hold four people each. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel - hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: rucip
Reviews.Content: We were in this hotel when in Madrid for a congress, and have booked 4 rooms there with my colleagues. We were all so pleased with it: nice large rooms with very large bathrooms; very clean; excellent restaurant with delicious breakfast; good position (close to metro, railway station Attocha, museum Reina Sofia). One limit - no free Internet (is this some new trend now? having to pay for wifi in hotels???) Anyhow, we would definitely go back if in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: Oasisgirl80
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here - so that says something straight away. My main priority was somewhere close to the station as I was stopping overnight to break a long journey from Seville to Tarragona. It ticked all the boxes - comfortable bed, good shower, kettle in the room, quiet despite location on main road, clean. Staff were polite and efficient. Food is nothing special. Actually my evening meal was just what I wanted after a few days of rich Spanish food - grilled fish served with salad and chips, pretty much like something I would have cooked up at home. Fine for a quick stop over on a business trip. But I guess if you were here on holiday you would go into town for a more typical Spanish restaurant with more atmosphere. The hotel is definitely aimed at the business traveller, but if I came to Madrid on holiday I wouldn't hesitate to stay here if a good deal was available. Tip - the hotel offers 5% discount if you have travelled there by long distance train, but you need to mention this at the time of booking, simply showing your train ticket when you turn up won't do it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CityTravellerUK123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a long weekend in February at the Carlton Hotel, Madrid. The location is ideal for a leisure break, close to the metro, galleries and if you're not adverse to a bit of walking it's not too far from Plaza Mayor and the surrounding bars and restaurants. The hotel was ideal for a leisure break. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful with a good level of English. We had a room facing on to the main road but noise wasn't a problem as the windows were double-double glazed. We didn't book breakfast so I can comment on the food but I would definitely return or recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Best Combination of Luxory Hotel for Reasonable Price in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mmorg767
Reviews.Content: First, it has been renovated in recent past and is a modern, classy hotel. Support staff are extremely helpful. Great buffet breakfast, which you can get included in room price. Room was extremely large, sheik and comfortable. Hotel is located just several minutes away from one of the major train stations in Madrid. Hence, going for day trip to Toledo etc. is very easy. Also about 10-15 minute walk from all the major museums. Shorter if you take bus. Subway only few minutes walk from hotel. Price was extremely reasonable considering the quality of the hotel. This hotel is not in the center of all the tourist hotels. We found that a plus since you can get to any part of town in about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: EmyTravel
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly for the most! Loved Madrid our room was recently remolded and spacious. The location was good but it could have been better. Overall good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - close to train station”
Reviews.Author: Second_City_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and selected the hotel based on TA reviews, as well as proximity to the train station. I couldn't have been more pleased w/ my selection. It is literally just a 5-10 minute walk from the train station. I took an early morning train from Seville and planned to tour Madrid for the day. Despite arriving at the hotel at 10 a.m., a room was already made available to me. Everyone at the front desk also spoke English which was very helpful. In addition, they even reserved a taxi that would accept a credit card payment for my trip to the airport. Overall, I was extremely pleased w/ this hotel selection.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay at the Carlton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leafylin
Reviews.Content: We also arrived at the hotel minus our luggage and the staff could not have been kinder or more helpful. In fact our luggage arrived at the hotel while we were touring Andalusia and they notified us and looked after our bags until we returned. The breakfast was a very extensive spread and was enough to keep us going as we walked the streets of Madrid. The renovations are very tasteful, and the rooms are a good size for Europe. I can't comment on the bar/dinner because I didn't go to Madrid to dine in my hotel. Great internet rate. No complaints only praise, can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “no new year celebrations!”
Reviews.Author: griff2
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for the new year celebrations and we found the hotel to be lacking in atmosphere !! The room in which we stayed was fine and the buffet breakfast was also acceptable, i agree with some of the reviews in the fact that the bar/lounge closed far to early for a mainstream city centre hotel! apart from that we enjoyed our stay in Madrid as there was plenty to see and the metro is near the hotel , I think when we return we will stay in the puerto del sol area in Madrid as it seem more busy with nice bars & restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tomma1982
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located for easy access to all Madrid locations. Hotel staff very pleasant and drinks in the cafe bar were reasonably priced although the food was a lot cheaper in other eating establishments around the area . NYE was amazing in the SOL area the atmosphere was electric! Anyone who is arriving at Barajas airport the easiest way to get to the hotel is via the metro from the airport to Nuevos Ministerios then changing onto the RENFE which is the train that leaves platform 2 and stops at the Atocha station when you leave the station the hotel is a 5 min walk and only costs 3 euros as opposed to 37 euros in a taxi. Definately recommend Madrid to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and a good location”
Reviews.Author: HobokenTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 2 blocks south of El Prado and a 15 minute walk to Plaza Mayor. The staff was excellent and accomodating. The hotel must have been renovated recently as the large rooms were totally modernized with brand new bathrooms, hardwood floors and huge flatpanel tv's. The hotel is on a main street so definitely ask for a room on a high floor in the back of the hotel. The breakfast was outstanding. An excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city hotel”
Reviews.Author: kernow1
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night as a break in a long journey. The hotel is in a great location. It is well presented, modern, classy with large rooms including sitting area and large well fitted and presented bathroom. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Just Right”
Reviews.Author: Jim_atl
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Carlton during Thanksgiving. I got a very good rate on their web site that included breakfast. The room was large and appeared to have been recently renovated. Our room did not have much noise, maybe because it faced a less busy street than some other people. As others have said, the location is great. We used it to get in from the train station and to take the high speed train to Toledo. It was also good for a visit to the Prado late in the day and is near 2 other museums. The breakfast had hot and cold food, which was more than enough to fill us up. This was my second stay at the Carlton and I would definitely stay there a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, traffic very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: donnyMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a long weekend at the Carlton. Really enjoyed the city and the hotel. On the positive side the hotel is in a great location for getting around. Just on the southern edge of the city Atocha station is a couple of 100m away, so easy access to the Metro (which is fantastic). Three main galleries are all in walking distance. The room we had was recently refurbished to an excellent standard, it was faultless. There were no bathrobes or tea making facilities which was a bit of a disappointment as they were shown on the web site, but apparently for suites only. The staff were helpful and friendly and spoke good English. The bar/ restaurant was almost deserted, everyone seems to go out to eat. Service could be a bit slow with very few customers. The breakfast was very expensive at 27 euros for 2. We went to one of the many local cafes where a cold breakfast was less then 7 euros. The one major issue with the hotel is its location. A big plus, but also a disadvantage. It is on one of the main roads into Madrid and the traffic is busy very late into the night. We had a street room and found the noise disturbing, especially on Friday and Saturday. The liberal use of horns and sirens is a common feature of driving in Madrid. I suspect any hotel in the city will suffer from noise (read the other reviews), you just need to be prepared. All in all an excellent choice and very much enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Close to art museums.”
Reviews.Author: mjb25
Reviews.Content: The staff here was helpful and friendly. The elevators are small, but to my surprise, the room was spacious and very nice. Make sure you get a room on an upper floor and away from the main street if you can. Traffic starts very early and the street is very busy. It is very close to the Prado and Renia Sophia museums. Do not miss the breakfast here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at an excellent value”
Reviews.Author: kaether0
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews on this site and I am glad we did. The rooms look modern, spacious and are very clean. The area around the hotel seemed fine to me, and it is very close to public transportation. The staff is very courteous and professional. The one thing that impressed me the most: one day by accident I left the key to our safe in the room. When we came back at night, the room had been made, and the key was left by the staff on top of the bed so we could see it. I checked the safe and nothing had been touched: passports, money, laptop, ipod, etc, everything was there. Great work, I am really impressed by the honesty of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jimmie09
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, spacious rooms, nice bathroom, and very accomodating staff! We found the location good, close to Madrid Vision bus tours, parks, shops, restaurants or coffee shops. We definitely would stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but room could have been better”
Reviews.Author: arimfc
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious and clean - but 2 single beds put together to make a double was annoying. Was also allocated a smoking room in a lower floor despite requesting a non-smoking upper room. Would also expect tea/coffee maker in a 4-star hotel. On the plus side, the hotel had a very good location, especially for the art galleries. Enjoyed very much our short stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “I’ll always stay here when I’m in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: pkwalkers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at both the beginning and end of my last trip to Spain and wish I had known about this hotel for previous trips. Got a great night sleep every night in the peaceful, spotless room. Staff were friendly, helpful, and very professional. Most importantly to me, the location is ideal for walking to everything I want access to: museums, gardens, train station, metro. This is an all-around great hotel, very comfortable, but not at all pretentious, reasonably priced for Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Carlton is a good unpretentious hotel worth a visit if you have to go to Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: stewartscotland1151
Reviews.Content: As an avid reader of tripadvisor reviews before booking anywhere I was encouraged by the tone of the reviews I read. I was not disapointed by the Hotel though I would say that it was a superior 3 star rather than a 4 star. For a city that supposedly never sleeps the Hotel Bar, basically part of the restuarent, closed at 11.30. Having read the reviews we contacted the hotel by email after booking to ask for a room on a higher floor in a quiet location. We got exactly what we asked for, room 706. Would reccomend this room, see photos we have posted, as it was at the corner of the building on the top floor. It was large, had a huge double bed, and semed to have been relatively recently refurbished. It had everything that you could ask for including a mini bar, that was useful to empty and fill with water etc purchased from the supermarket 50 yards away. We breakfasted twice during our four night stay and the breakfast at E13.50 was very good, but I am afraid not as good as some reviewers who rated it the best they have experienced. They should try H10 Marina Barcelona for what is a magnificent buffet breakfast including Cava! Hotel staff were friendly, but we did make the effort to use our limited Spanish, always helps. No noise from adjacent rooms and fresh towels every day. Surrounding area is a bit dull with little in the way of bars and restuarents but the metro is only 75 yards away which takes you to Sol in a few stops which is a good central point to explore. The tourist bus has a stop very nearby and this is an excellent way to see the city. There are many flashier hotels in Madrid, but most of these are in the middle of the congested, noisy and frankly not too attractive central district. The parts of Madrid that we enjoyed most were to theperiphery of the centre, Retiro Park is a must to escape the noise and the hustle and bustle, relax with some stunning scenery and enjoy a quiet drink or some food. All of the food outlets are at the north west corner of the park. Plaza Oriente, Temple Of Debod and Royal Palace are also excellent places to have a seat in the sun and watch the world go by in quiet surroundings. We found Madrid expensive. With the £ and E almost at parity this is not too much of a surprise I suppose. Prices did vary dramatically though from place to place and whether you drank and ate outside or inside. So beware. Madrid was good to see, but we will return again to Barcelona rather than Madrid for our next city visit to Spain. There is of course also Valencia, Seville, Palma, San Sebastian..................et al!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CrashcatMW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 3 minutes from the Atocha train station, which is nice if you are using the train station often during your stay. It is also very close to the Atocha metro station and the Reina Sofia museum. We walked everywhere from this hotel. The staff was pleasant and spoke English. The rooms were very clean and modern and the bed very comfy. All rooms have bathrooms en suite. I usually don't sleep well in hotels but was able to get a good nights sleep here. The only complaint I would have is the walls are thin and the couple next to us were having arguments well into the night and we could hear every word they said very clearly. They didn't have free wi-fi (coming in January they said), but they did have Internet connection in the lobby for 4 euros per hour. There is a pastry shop across the street. May I recommend the chocolate croissant. YUM!

Reviews.Title: “nice, but not gracious. very thin walls could hear noise of others”
Reviews.Author: jg12318
Reviews.Content: sleek European style...but no directions how to operate shower or a/c

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel for a solo woman”
Reviews.Author: JustOneBoomer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a five minute walk from the main Atocha train station, so the location is ideal for someone planning to take a day trip to Toledo or planning to leave for anywhere else by train. It is also very close to the Museum Reina Sofia which has an area of cafes and restaurants in front of it. I also walked from the hotel to the Parque Retiro, the Prado and the Thyssen Museum. If you're not a walker, I am told that the metro is easily accessed, but I did not need to use it. The hotel is sort of on a transitional street. If you continue to walk away from the train station, past the hotel, the neighborhood seems to be less upscale, but I didn't feel unsafe and some friends and I wandered into a restaurant one evening where they took good care of us. My room was very nice (Rm. 617). It had a queen size bed and the decor was sleek and calming. It had sliding glass doors that you could close to lessen any hall noise. The room was in the interior of the hotel, so no view, but I'll happily trade that for quiet. The bath room was large, clean and well appointed. You could control the heat or AC. One reviewer stated that the maid turned off the AC, but the electricity turns off when you remove your room key from the slot by the door to conserve power. There were two computer terminals in the lobby with a printer which came in handy for printing out directions or a boarding pass. They charge a euro for 15 minutes). I also used it to book train tickets for some friends who wanted to go to Toledo. If you are thinking of a day trip to Toledo, I definitely advise booking your train tickets using the Renfe website. One of the people at the reception desk helped us. (One year my sons and I spent a long time standing in line at the station only to find that they had sold out of tickets for that day.) I never ate in the hotel restaurant. To me, 13.50 Euros is a lot for breakfast. On the other hand, if that ends up being breakfast and lunch, perhaps it's worth it. There are plenty of little places to grab a Spanish style breakfast of coffee and a toasted sandwich and/or a pastry and juice. I did have one interesting experience. The hotel had flyers in the elevator and that they distributed touting their welcome dinner. It was in English and Spanish, but the English was incorrect to the point of silliness. Dessert was described as "ice cream with scum and chocolate". I suggested some changes in translation to the front desk and they were quite grateful. When I returned later, the signs had been changed. I took a cab to Barajas Airport from the hotel. They called a cab on a Sunday morning for me. The ride was 30 euros. One can also go by metro, but I wasn't up to lugging my suitcase up and down stairs. I paid $130 per night for a room with no breakfast, booking through 1800hotels. The location was quite convenient for the major museums, but for nightlife, one might prefer a hotel closer to the Puerta del Sol - Plaza Mayor -- Opera house area. I

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, just leave my AC alone”
Reviews.Author: agedude
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia at $104 per night. Good price and a five minute walk to Atocha train station. Older 4* property but nicely appointed with paid internet access in lobby and wireless access in rooms but 17.10 Euro for 24 hours. Good sized room with 2 twin beds, decent bathroom. TV had CNN, BBC world news, Eurosport, and MSNBC in English. Small table inside room with two small easy chairs. Great location if arriving by train or taking a day train trip to Toledo. If going to Segovia or north by train, Atocha Station has a metro stop and on the line (line 1) goes directly to Charmartin station without changing lines. 15 minute walk to Prado, 20 to Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum, and 5 minutes to Sofia Renia. I walked from hotel to Plaza Mayor and Palace Royal. Two complaints about room; maid staff was trained to turn off Air Conditioner when room was not occupied. Not fun after walking through a museum and several miles throughout the city to return to a warm room. Second problem was a adjacent room was undergoing renovation so lot's of banging and construction sounds from 0900 to 1800. Not a problem if you are sightseeing but a real downer for a jet-lagged day sleeper. Good staff. Breakfast (13.50 Euro) and dinner (13-25 Euro for main course) were a little too expensive for my taste but plenty of restaurants in the local area. There is also a supermarket about 30 meters south. Overall fine hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MaryKayTampa_FL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of all 3 major museums. Also 2 blocks from a stop on the hop on hop off Madrid Vision Bus tours. Has a mini fridge in room recently remodeled with a beautiful bathroom and very large room. Can walk to a supermarket within 1 block. Great value and location. Also has numerous cafes and restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, very friendly & helpful Reception staff”
Reviews.Author: YogaLing
Reviews.Content: Got a brilliant deal through EasyJet - flights, taxes and two nights at the Carlton thrown in, all in for £267.50 for two of us! So worth checking for deals before booking. Given the incredible deal, suffice to say breakfast wasn't incuded but we were happy to grab brekkie along our way to sight-seeing. Hotel is close to two metro lines and less than 5mins walk to Reina Sofia gallery, 10 mins to Botanical gdns and max. 15min to Padro museum/gallery and the Retiro park. Rooms were really modern and extremely spacious. Hotel staff very knowledgeable and helpful. Airport to hotel door on the metro took under just an hour. Madrid's metro system is easy to use, cheap and very clean...if only London was the same! ;o(

Reviews.Title: “Charming, no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssm244
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. There were three of us, so we booked 2 rooms, each about $75. Parking is in a convenient lot around the corner, about $12 euros. The location is good for the Reine Sofia and Atocha, about a 20 minute walk to Puerta del Sol and 15 to Prado. The rooms were small, but clean and efficient. The concierge spoke perfect english and was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mistaya71
Reviews.Content: Our choice for this hotel in Madrid was based on a combination of the reviews here on TA and the price (EUR 80 per night including breakfast and taxes) and we were not disappointed. Guided by previous posters' comments we asked for a quiet room on a higher floor and were given room 710. Unlike most other standard rooms this one did not have a seating area with two comfy chairs in the room (it did have a desk and chair though) but it did have a balcony with a parasol, table and chairs! The room is located at the very end of the corridor (not on the side, you walk into it) and on the back of the hotel and as such is extremely quiet. This particular room only has a (very nice) walk-in shower, not a bathtub (we didn't care) and a queen bed that was comfy enough. The air-conditioning did everything it should do and the shutters helped keeping the heat from the sun out. The choice at breakfast was huge and the quality was very good. The restaurant was clean and the service very un-Spanish (quick). Locationwise it was perfect for us. This hotel is away from the main hustle and bustle (15-20 minute walk to Plaza Mayor) which means it is more quiet than those that are in the very centre. Both Metro Line 3 and Line 1 have stations that are just a few foot steps away from the hotel. The underground system in Madrid is excellent: fast, easy and clean and although we were a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews here we never felt unsafe, not on the Metro nor on the streets around Plaza Mayor and between the square and the hotel in the evening. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful, a huge difference from the waiters at the several restaurants and tapas bars we tried (including some waiters at the Mercado San Miguel, which is nevertheless a must-see) and the Madrilenos in general. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if we would ever go back to Madrid. This is however highly unlikely: Barcelona has more atmosphere, friendlier people, more variety in things to see and do and better, more unique (handcraft) shops and given the choice we will always go back to Barcelona. But the Hotel Carlton Madrid is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: OscarHeycuff
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty safe bet. I stayed here twice and was satisfied both times. The rooms were spotless, the bathrooms are large and clean. The staff was helpful. It's a little off the beaten path - a five minute walk from the train station, and about a 20 minute walk to Plaza Mayor.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: removalman
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Carlton in mid-July, temperatures were up to 39C - that's hot! That made the fully air conditioned hotel a terrific place to stay. Couple that with large rooms with very modern fitted bathrooms, lifts to all floors, within a short stroll of Atocha train and metro station and the Palos de la Frontera metro and you start to have the makings of an ideal base to explore Madrid. The buffet breakfast comes in at an eyewatering 13.50 Euro. For that you get an amazing choice, fried eggs, boiled eggs, spanish omelette, mushrooms, bacon, cereals, a couple of choices of juice, rolls, toast, various teas and coffees, pastries, a variety of fresh fruit, cooked meats, cheeses, some smoked fish, cheesecake and even a glass of wine was available. It was not the same two days running, they just seemed to put out what was freshly available. No restrictions on what you could have, but they justifiably only had small plates to discourage the serial 'grazers'. The good news is that the Hotel does deals that include the buffet breakfast - snap them up. The service in the hotel was good, but they have some extras that you may use that will add to the bill. You have to pay extra for internet access and the room safe for starters - so bare that in mind. The rooms were cleaned well each day with plenty of space for clothes. The rooms have CRT televisions with a couple of English speaking news channels. All rooms are equipped with air conditioning that works well. Entry to rooms is by card system which also opens the front doors if you come back after midnight, although the reception desk is manned 24/7. If you have a late flight and want to leave your luggage after vacating your room, they will look after it in reception for no charge. All in all one of the better Hotels I have stayed in. Value is all about the price you pay for what you get. So my positive review has to be balanced against the £428 I paid for seven nights for a double non-smoking room, including breakfast. That was a great deal obtained by early booking and taking advantage of all the online discounts from their web site. If you can get anywhere near the price point I achieved I would unhesitatingly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacainVA
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat: walking distance to the museums and the train station. The hotel was better than I expected for a European hotel and clean. We stayed there at the front and tail end of our trip - both times staying on the seventh floor. The first room was decent - a little noisy from the traffic on the busy street and thin walls with noisy neighbors in the room next door. The second stay we were in a bigger room (and bigger bathroom) and it was on the back of the 7th floor and quieter. They charged for the internet in the lobby (a few euros for a half hour) and two euros per night to use the room safe. The receptionist staff we fine but not overly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with nice staff and awesome breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Dollars1996
Reviews.Content: While our trip to Spain had its challenges, the staff at this hotel provided a safe haven for some of the troubles we faced during our visit. We had a room on the end and it had lots of room for a european hotel. We stayed in 515 on the 1st few nights and 608 after we returned from Barcelona. The breakfast was great with both scrambled and poached eggs, meats, chesses, cafe, juice and fruit. Ofcourse there were churros and this very tasty potato dish called Tortilla Espanola. Eat in the hotel, becuase most places in this country are cash only! The rooms were always clean and cool, which was good after the very hot a muggy day of dealing with the locals... The rudness and strange looks made us feel unwelcomed in this country. Also as others have pointed out, there is a 24 hour convienance store right up the street with everthing you need........ The best part, they at least took credit cards! All in all, the hotel and staff is great, its way from the busy shopping area called Plaza Del SOL and and quiet enough to get a good nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GYK
Reviews.Content: As we intended to travel around Spain by train we chose this hotel as it was just a short walk from the main Atocha Stn. It was a safe area to walk in with no drunks or druggies hanging around. Our room was medium size, comfortable, extremely clean and faced the side street so was quiet. All the staff were exceptionally helpful and informative. The TV had all the English news channels available. You do have to pay 2 Euros a day should you want to use the in-room safe, and when I wanted to check my emails and do an online checkin for our return flight I had to pay 4 Euro for 30 minutes use of the computer. The hotel is in easy walking distance for visiting the Prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen Museums as well as the beautiful Retiro Park and Botanical Gardens. There are many cafes and restaurants in the area but we found the very attractive 'Samar Kanda' restaurant, situated in the Atocha Stn but up at a higher level, to have an excellent menu and service - although it is a little more expensive than others in the area. They stop serving main meals at 4pm, after which snacks and drinks are available. If, like us, you are Seniors, and intend to travel by rail to a numbers of places, then before you purchase your tickets show your passport to prove you are over 65 and purchase for 5 Euro a 'Tarjeta Dorada'. With this card all your rail tickets will be 50% less (except for travel on Sat/Sun when it is only 25% less). Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for tourists – don’t miss Casa Patas a short walk away”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadsrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel being located next to the main train station (Atocha) I expected worse. In fact this hotel is wonderful if you’re in for sightseeing Madrid. Two subway stations on different lines are close, but to be honest we have not used those much, except when coming from the airport and one time when we went for a corrida in Las Ventas. You can just walk everywhere from the hotel: Reina Sofia Museum is next door, Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza museums, plus Retiro Park a short walk away, centre (Porta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Royal Palace etc) not very far if you like to walk and get the feeling of the town. One subway station away, near Anton Martin stop (or about 10-15 minutes walk) is Casa Patas, a definitely must go: superb traditional restaurant with incredible flamenco show. It’s the real thing, not the touristy version, and an experience I will always remember. The food and the wine were also excellent. I heard many Hollywood starts have been there and I can definitely see why. Back to the hotel, they did nothing to ruin the wonderful visit to Madrid. Quite large and sunny room, a spotless and modern bathroom (I think the whole place must have been renovated not long ago), breakfast buffet very good, helpful staff, decent pricing.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay in Carlton!”
Reviews.Author: tomaCt
Reviews.Content: Great location (walking distance from Atocha trains station, 10min walk from Prada, good restaurants, parks), very friendly, helpful, English speaking staff, clean modern rooms. We loved everything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is really great”
Reviews.Author: aott02
Reviews.Content: It is close to many of the attractions in Madrid. It is a safe neighborhood with small shops and grocery stores and pharmacies if you need it. The rooms were very comfortable and really nicely decorated. We loved the breakfast, and the staff was most helpful at all times. My only complaint was that the internet is a bit expensive (about 18 euros a day), and there is no pool. The room price I think is fair, although it is not cheap (a bit over $100/night with breakfast included). Overall, we were really happy and pleased here, and I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Carlton”
Reviews.Author: BenMan
Reviews.Content: Great location (a long block from Atocha Station, gateway to Cordoba and Seville), friendly staff, gorgeous modern rooms. My wife and I had never been to Madrid before and this was our first stop. We picked it because of its proximity to Atocha Station. Hotel was extremely clean, quiet, and the staff were very helpful. (Shower was rather complicated to use... the girl they sent up to explain it to us was patient and thorough.) We had asked for a nonsmoking room but they gave us a smoking room -- but it was so clean and fresh we could not tell. And my wife is VERY sensitive to smoke. Neighborhood is full of nice places to eat with the locals, especially if you walk in the direction of the Prado, which is not far. Front desk staff speak English (but learn some Spanish, it will take you a long way in Madrid). After our experience of being robbed in Barcelona we were skitting about taking on another Spanish city, but Madrid was wonderful and the Carlton made us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Ok location, but not so good hotel”
Reviews.Author: caligirl888
Reviews.Content: This was my least favorite hotel during my trip to Spain. The hotel is outdated, smells too much like cheap soap, and the rooms are dingy. It is also very very noisy. They charge you for wifi, charge you at the business center, charge you for using the lock box in your room... ridiculous. The only plus at this hotel is the front desk staff who are very very helpful and the breakfast buffet. Location wise, it's waking distance to the train station and the metro stop. It's only a couple of stops away from Puerta Sol where all the action is, but it is close (15-20 min walk) to the Museu del Prado and Museu de Reina Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, quiet room, good location, good breakfirst”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Park
Reviews.Content: I stay 2 nights during Madrid tour. This hotel is small and room is small, too, BUT, employees are kind, location is very good near from atocha metro and rail station. Moreover, breakfirst is diverse and delicious. Specially, room has a pot which you can get hot water with. If I could visit madrid again, I will stay this hotel one more time.

Reviews.Title: “Good find near Atocha Station with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JesseSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: On a recent leisure trip to Madrid my husband selected this hotel, largely due to it's proximity to Atocha Station, which erroneously he anticipated we'd be using alot to get to side trips outside Madrid. (We ended up using buses instead.) It turned out to be a pleasant find. Our room was large with a large bathroom as well. (Not all are that big I don't think.) Very modern look to it. Reasonably well appointed, with a big closet. But the best part was the front desk staff that was very friendly and helpful. We stayed for a week there and they helped us figure out various things including the hours places were open and where various bus stations were located. Our room came with breakfast and it was an outstanding breakfast buffet. The best we had in our whole trip. The hotel is quite well situated to many of the art museums, especially the Reina Sophia, although we need to advise one to be careful in that square near the Museum as my husband's backpack got stolen while eatting at an outdoor cafe there. But the hotel people were helpful with that also. The major negative was that the Internet availability at the hotel was very expensive and didn't always work well and the immediate neighborhood at night wasn't overly attractive. While there were decent nearby restaurants these weren't as appealing as some in other areas and generally were more sparse. It's between two Metro stops - about 4 blocks from either and there is an internet cafe a block away that charges only 1 euro an hour. The building itself looks fairly new and we found it quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but....”
Reviews.Author: LenandMy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok but staff friendliness is not that good. The rooms are clean and well maintained. No problem with security. There is a 2 Euro charge per day for in room safe. Location is perfect, only 5 min walk to central train station. You can take a train to Toledo, only 40min. Internet is pretty expensive in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid City of great culture”
Reviews.Author: Hildo
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend in Madrid with seven others, it was initially a football tour: however, this city has much more to offer. We stayed in the Carlton Hotel, although not quite central suited our purpose. It was only 5 Euros in a taxi to the city centre (Wait thats 5 quid now) lol, The hotel was clean and the service was superb, everywhere we went the people were really friendly and welcoming. We toured Real Madrid's stadium and at 15 Euros it was well worth it. I would return for a holiday just for the Tapas bars alone (superb) Hildo.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkennedy38
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during a 4 day stay in Madrid. The hotel was spotless, well stocked, and within close proximity to the train station. Our standard room was spacious and the bathroom was sizeable. The room had extensive storage space. Noise was not a problem, neither from the street or other rooms. The staff was courteous, prompt, and attentive. The front desk staff always helped with directions with a smile. Breakfast was good. It had a lot of variety including fresh fruit. The bar had a nice menu. The bar had GREAT Sangria! All and all we were thrilled and would stay again. It is a good location, nice staff, and good food service. We were able to walk to various points of interest from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Bigperm86
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton for 2 nites in November 08. Took train from Valencia, the Carlton is 2 blocks from the Atocha train station, so it was a short walk(one of the reasons i booked it). We had about two hours before the Reina Sofia(Guernica) closed, so we checked in, which was hassle-free, and ran over there, which was only about a 5-10 min. walk. The room and bathroom were immaculate, great, great room, and the hotel desk were very friendly. Also within walking distance was the Prado and the Botannical Gardens. Note that there is only 1 entrance to the Botannical gardens(we thought we could cut-through on the way back to the hotel). Take a cab to the Royal Palace. We walked from the Royal Palace to the Prado back to the hotel, and that was fine. There's a lot of great, low-cost food options right around the hotel. Of the 4 hotels we stayed in Spain this was by far my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Carlton - Perfect City Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bidele
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Carlton in Madrid for a birthday treat for my husbands birthday to see a Real Madrid football game from 23rd January until 26th January 2009. The hotel is very centrally located to subway / Atocha station, the sub way is one of best I have ever used, very easy to get around the city this way. Rooms in the Carlton were really good size and bathroom was very nice (recently refurbished). The hotel itself sits on a busy road and the traffic does not stop all night long, but this is a city and most citys have noise all night. There was metal shutters on outisde of your room window which you could release down, this seemed to shut out some of the noise. The reception staff and bar man were all very nice and friendly. This hotel is perfect for a short weekend trip to Madrid and would recommend to anyone heading to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
