Reviews.Author: HelenDavis84
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Carlton for a mini break to Madrid. It was a great location near the Atoca train station. There is a 24 supermarket nearby. The room was spacious with a big bathroom. The staff were friendly and spoke good English.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: leewenliamdan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the carlton in oct 2008 for long weekend. Rooms are clean and spacious,front desk are helpful,most of the staff speak english. In a good location,within walking distance of museums,atocha train stations and retiro park. Top tip if you've never been to madrid,use the metro to travel everywhere! It's spotless ,reliable,cheap and easy to use.It's 2 euros to central madrid from the airport compared to 25+ in a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: bubblegal
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Carlton was very nice - very clean modern and rooms are very spacious for a city hotel. You are within walking distance to most of the attractions - although not far from the metro - which we used as you can get daily tourist cards very cheaply - and is much safer to use than walk around at night. Only disappointment is it was a treat for my birthday - and unfortunatley the hotel had not notified us that were refurbishments happening. We were woken up at 7am in the morning to people decorating the rooms next door.// all you could hear were people taping the carpet, talking and scraping off wallpaper. The walls were very thin (you could even hear toilets flushing from surrounding rooms). Also the bedside light did not work - we notified reception who advised that they would fix it the next day - this never happened. We did get a very good rate at this hotel however feel we should have atleast been notified (even when checking in) that we may experience some inconvenience - at least we would not have been as annoyed when woken up very early on a holiday away. ]Overall - if no refurbishment was going on - I would definatley reccommend - but maybe not if u do like to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loved the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: sbouckley
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel, only 2 minutes walk from Atocha railway station on a busy street. Reception staff were very efficient and pleasant. Check in was quick. The lifts are quite small so if you have a lot of luggage it may be a squeeze! We were on the 6th floor so street noise was less intrusive and at night there is a roller shutter on the window which blocks out all light from the outside. The room was adequate, with TV, minibar, seating area and decent wardrobe space. It was very nicely decorated and immacuately clean. The bathroom was extremely pleasant, and ultra modern with a white bathroom suite and limestone tiles, and the shower was great with a choice of shower heads! There is a powerful hairdryer in the bathroom and no need to bring any toiletries as there is a very good array of complimentary ones provided. A 24 hour supermarket is 200m from the hotel, which is a bonus as the minibar is expensive, at 3 euros for a can of coke and 6 euros for a small bottle of cava. So, all in all, we had a very pleasant stay at the Carlton, the only downside is that we didn't have time to sample the breakfast but looking through to the restaurant, it looked like there was great choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoocyLoosy
Reviews.Content: My friends and I, all in our fifties, spent 3 nights in this hotel and found it to be excellent. It has a pleasant bar area and reception with friendly and helpful staff. Our rooms were quite large, nicely decorated, spotlessly clean and had super efficient air-conditioning - essential as the outside temperature was 40 degrees plus. The bathrooms were bright, modern and well equipped, towels were changed daily and shower gel, shampoo etc replaced. It was situated near enough to the main attractions - Plaza Mayor, Sol, Prado etc not to need to use public transport but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the city so as not to be too noisy at night. All in all a nice stay and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: IO_OI
Reviews.Content: Good location and room size is good. HIghly recommended , especially if you are doing day trip to toledo , etc. Close to Atocha and about 15 mins walk to prado museum. perfect !!

Reviews.Title: “Good Base”
Reviews.Author: CAM52
Reviews.Content: Location .. Within walking distance of Atocha Station and near one of the "Open Top Bus" stops. Metro station also within a 5 min walk. We found the area around the hotel safe at night. Reception.. Check-in was speedy and maps were provided. Room .. Well appointed and clean. Good A/C and comfortable beds. Tea and coffee maker provided. The floor in our room was wooden. Bathroom .. Modern and clean. The shower was very good. Breakfast .. This hotel provides an outstanding breakfast - the best we had on this trip. Beautifully cooked scrambled eggs and a choice of over 100 different items!!! Recommendation.. The Carlton Hotel provides a good base for exploring exciting Madrid. Try to book with breakfast included as it really is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: MrsQuesne
Reviews.Content: We booked by telephone from San Sebastian two days before our arrival, as our other alternatives for our last night in Madrid before leaving Spain were completely booked. Luckily, the Carlton offered us a room for 100 euros. On arrival we discovered that the room was actually more of a suite, with a "living room" with chairs and a sofa, coffee-making facilities, well stocked minibar, 2 television sets and a huge bathroom! We were actually a little worried that I had not heard correctly when the price was discussed, but on checking out we were presented with a bill for 100 euros, as agreed. The room was facing an inner courtyard, and was very quiet. It was clean and had comfortable beds. The extremely dated decor deserves a mention: I don't think i have seen walls painted with a "clouded blue sky" effect since 1986. The bright blue chairs and sofa added to the feeling of being back in the 80s. The light brown of the bathroom porcelain felt more like the 70s. But it really didn't bother us, as it was only for one night we found it a bit entertaining. For a longer stay the walls could possibly give me a headache. The location was perfect for us, as it is only a short walk from the Reina Sofia art museum, where we went to see the Guernica before leaving for the airport. As we only stayed for one night we did not need much help from the front desk staff, but they helped us with finding a nice restaurant close by, and were friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: balletmaniac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. I had a single room on the 7th floor that had a little balcony with a table and chair. The room was nice but the bathroom was quite small. The bath had a glass enclosure, making it difficult to get into and out of the bath. All the windows have double glazing which cuts out all traffic noise. However, the walls are very thin and I could hear people in the room next door. I also got woken up by people arriving late at night who slammed their doors. On my first night, there was a loud sound of machinery nearby. This went on till about midnight. It sounded like it came from the hotel, as the double glazing is so good I couldn't hear anything from outside. When I complained the next morning, the hotel staff said they had no idea what the noise could have been, but quickly moved me to a better room (a suite with a double bed). This was on the first floor and was a huge improvement. The bathroom was large and had a spa bath. There was a lot more wardrobe space. There was also a second door that insulated the room from any noise from the corridor. I wasn't charged extra for the room, but would happily have paid more as I had a very peaceful night's sleep on the second night. It was room 802 in case anyone wants to book it. The hotel apparently don't have many suites. The breakfast buffet at the hotel cost £13 and was well worth the money. You can get a cooked breakfast (bacon, eggs, mushrooms), toast, croissants, cold meat, yoghurt, cereal, juice and lots more. The hotel is located about 5 minutes walk from Atocha station. It's perfectly located if you are travelling to or from Atocha. I would stay at the Hotel Carlton again if I return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Carlton, good location and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: RHMStirling
Reviews.Content: The goal was to find a four star hotel that offered an inclusive rate for B&B - few do in Madrid - and one located close to, but not in, the old town. Hotel Carlton fitted our criteria and looked good on paper. And so it proved to be in real life. We had a first floor room that looked onto an inner courtyard, not much of a view, but certainly quiet. The room was excellent with a good sized lounge opening into a large double bedroom, off which was a large well appointed bathroom - all very spacious, well furnished and decorated. The room came with a mini bar, safe (addlt cost option), tea and coffee making facilities, two TVs and a wide range of complimentary soaps, shampoos and such like. The breakfast buffet included hot and cold food, was of good quality with plentiful choice - a great start to the day. We tried the hotel restaurant on one evening; the food was o.k. - nothing special and not really value for money. Spanish cuisine is very much a personal taste and finding a good restaurant – as opposed to a bar or café – is not easy. The Spanish also prefer to eat late, often from 10 p.m. onwards Location; just 10 minutes from a Metro station, within 15 minutes walk of the old town, or the fabulous Retiro Park – well worth a visit, particularly on a Sunday – when the locals visit the park to stroll, listen to live music, or just enjoy the sun. Plenty of local sights, galleries and museums, railway station all within 5 to 15 minutes walk. Overall a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “OK....Not 4* rating”
Reviews.Author: stevee123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the "outskirts" of what Priceline calls Old Madrid. It is quite a walk to the different plazas where most of the tourists want to be. However it is quite close to the Museums. I paid $190 US per night which I thought was a little high for Priceline but it was last minute and it was May Day weekend. Bath: Very Nice Bed: Not Very Nice (An American hotel would go out of business with this bed) Environment: Noisy and we had an inside room! Breakfast: Not included with the Priceline Rate (Hotel wanted an additional 13 EURO per person....NO THANKS !) Very close to train station.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: gypsype
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the hotel. Though reception had a business-like approach we found them friendly and helpful. The rooms and shower facilities were reasonably spacious and very clean. Breakfasts were great and we loved sitting at the bar for a sundowner. The Carlton is centrally positioned and once we had worked out the metro we were able to to get around easily. Attocha station is easy walking distance and a trip to Toldedo (takes +- 40 mins) is a must. The only fault we could find is that the hotel does not have International adaptors available and I couldn't find a shop in the vicinity that stocked them. Otherwise I highly recommend the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad...”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlily6550
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't as bad as I thought it would be after having read some reviews. From the airport we bought the 10 ticket pass and went to the Atocha subway stop after transferring once. From there it was about a 5 minute walk. The neighborhood the hotel is located in is not that great but for the price you can't beat it. The staff at the front desk was fine..I guess we didn't get the rude person. Our room was on the 4th floor looking out of our window at another building. The room was larger than I expected and our bathroom was quite large. It was all very clean and looked as if the room had been recently painted and the bathroom looked remodeled. We didn't have any problems with the bed. Also there was some noise one night of loud guests but other than that it wasn't too bad. Breakfast at the hotel is exspensive but since there is nothing close by to eat at you really don't have much choice. The selection was very good with lots of different food options to choose from. They also serve dinner at the restuarant but nothing looked real appetizing to us. I guess we are just not used to some of the food served there. The location of the hotel is quite good. You are close to the train station and also to many of the museums. The Reina Sofia is very close by. Near the Sofia is a pizza restaurant where we ate a couple of times called Pinocchios. It wasn't as exspensive as lot of the other places. We couldn't find anywhere decent to eat near the hotel. We even asked at the front desk and they said there was nowhere to eat. Overall we had a good experience and would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Madrid, loved the Carlton”
Reviews.Author: emmab72002
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Carlton for 5 nights at the end of March 08. Loved the hotel, only found one tiny fault: The air conditioning-because of the time of year, only the heating worked, and as the weather outside was warm, it made our room boiling. We ended up having to leave windows open (we were up on the 5th floor so not a problem) but I would like the air con to be available if you wish. Other than that we can't fault the hotel-the reception staff were all very friendly and spoke english, i was expecting them not to be friendly having read other reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. Jorge checked us in and helped with any problems, he was very efficient and friendly. The hotel provided us with helpful info-a big Madrid map in the room, and also a 'Madrid Style' book which gave lots of hints and tips, including good restaurants etc. On travelling from the airport, we got the metro (1€ for a single trip but you have to pay 1€ supplement charge from the airport-the machines are very easy to use, or €6.70 for a ten trip ticket-again with the supplement if you buy from the airport) I found the easiest route whilst you're getting your bearings is line 8 (pink) all the way to Nuevos Ministerios, then line 10 (dark blue) to Tribunal, then light blue (1) to Sol and then the yellow line (3) to Palos de la Frontera. The walk from here is very easy (out of the station, turn left onto Paseo de las Delicias and keep walking for about 5 minutes), however when you get your bearings, Atocha metro station is near too and you don't have to change metro as often. I recommend travelling via Palos de la Frontera whilst you've got suitcases-coming from Atocha there are a few big roads to cross. A few experiences from Madrid- Go to Toledo, the trains run quite regulary from Atocha Renfe station very close to the hotel, and it's a beautiful old city, worth travelling out of Madrid for. The tour of Estadio Santiago Bernabeu was brilliant, well worth the money, as was the tour of the bull fighting stadium (metro to Ventas) which is a beautiful building whether you're for or against the fights. The tour is conducted in spanish and english, and the tour guide was very helpful. We found Sol the place to be of a nighttime, La Tosta on Calle Victoria had lovely sangria for €10, and the very friendly barstaff gave us free tapas. Well worth a visit! All in all, i couldn't recommend the Carlton Hotel more, the location may be a little bit out of the way for some, but you can infact walk to the Gran Via in 15 mins, and it's only 5 minutes on the metro to Sol. The price we paid was brilliant, the whole experience was amazing and we didn't want to come back to England at the end!

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated - friendly - hard beds”
Reviews.Author: heelas
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to this hotel - buy 10-ticket 'Metrobus' at airport. Add 2 euros supplement each way for getting to and from airport. The airport is huge and empty - takes ages to walk to the gates - use the lifts and not escalators to save time. Nearest metro stop is Palos de la Frontera (line 3) and 5 mins walk. Hotel a bit dated in appearance. Ask for a quiet inside room - they are smaller but away from traffic noise. You can still hear next door and people walking above. World's hardest hotel beds! Prepare for a stiff back in the morning. Breakfast is good but expensive at 13 euro. There is a good cafe just beyond the Metro on the same side of the street instead. Beware of pickpockets in Madrid - I nearly had a bag stolen that was by my feet in an ice cream bar at Atosha - the waitress alerted me just in time. You can walk from hotel to Retiro park, Atosha railway station, Reine Sofia modern art gallery, Prado and many other places. Hotel is well situated - not too central but the Metro is so good you need not pay more for a more central location. try the wonderful Museo de Jamon for the bets hams and other meals - there is one near the hotel and it is good for snacks and full meals too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gemmasb
Reviews.Content: I made my booking over the hotels website which was really easy to use and booking details could be checked online after to ensure confirmation. No need to pay any thing in advance The hotel was easy to find and close to the metro. Good location for museums and gardens, about a 15 min walk to the Plaza Mayor. Nice square near to the Art Gallery only two or three mins walk. Lots of Tapas restaurant/bars nearby for snacks and drinks. Would recommended to others, as it good value compared to other hotels in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “For business Great! Sight seers not so great”
Reviews.Author: egfromftl
Reviews.Content: The hotel Carlton is nicely kept up, rooms are big and modern and the view from the 6th floor over the city was nice. However, if you are here to see Madrid I think you could find more centrally located hotels that would meet your needs. If I had known more about the city (I did try to find some details - central locations and the like) I would have preferred a room near the Palace since this it seems is the hub of activity in Madrid. Back to the hotel - since it seems that The Carlton serves mainly business people the staff at the front desk was of little help when I wanted to see the sights or find a good Tapas bar. Instead I was left to my own to figure out what could be seen in the limited amount of time I had. I figured that the Opera and Palace where good places to start, but when I asked again at the desk about getting to this part of town little help was provided in any way shape or form. My room had a nice view of the city and a great big bath room - both very nice. However, the bed was like a rock. That said the Carlton made up for many of its shortcomings when I got up the next morning and headed to breakfast - WOW what a spread and the service was VERY pleasant - unlike the desk staff. Tons of choices and fresh squeezed juice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: DBSF
Reviews.Content: This hotel was average, a clean place to sleep after trekking around Madrid. I have to say, it was not quite as nice as I had expected after looking at their website---do not be fooled by the modern-appearing rooms they display on the home page of their website. That being said, it was very well-maintained and very clean. The breakfast buffet was also very good, excellent variety of food. The location was a bit odd---the street wasn't so inviting, especially at night, although we never had any specific problems. But, the Prado museum, Museu de Reina Sofia, Metro, and train station were all within a few blocks. The front desk staff was mostly nice, but one woman was kind of an airhead. Our airline had left her suitcase in Barcelona, but called ahead to let the hotel know when the suitcase would be delivered. When the suitcase was delivered, the brainiac front desk woman told the airline that my friend wasn't staying there (she must not have checked her computer, since our room was registered to this friend). She tried to get out of her faus pax by saying there was no name on the suitcase, she didn't have any information about the plan for the suitcase delivery (a load of crap, since as soon as she heard my friend's name, she very obviously revealed the fact that she mistakenly sent the luggage away). She rectified the situation by calling the airline and having the suitcase delivered shortly thereafter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Wideblue
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay having booked on the strength of previous TripAdvisor reviews. As others have said, the hotel is a little out of the centre but only 5 minutes' walk from Palos de la Frontera Metro station (Line 3). The Metro is very frequent and runs until 1.30am, and you can buy a ticket valid for 10 journeys on bus / Metro for €6.70 so getting around is not a problem. We found the Carlton clean and comfortable and the staff were perfectly pleasant. Our room (on the fourth floor) had not been refurbished but was more than adequate for our needs. Unfortunately, our request for a room at the back of the hotel wasn't met and we were allocated one overlooking the very busy road below. Light sleepers be warned, insist on a room at the back of the property or you'll be awake most of the night! Breakfast was excellent with a wide choice of fruit, cereals, ham (5 varieties!) and pastries, or if you prefer a cooked meal scrambled / fried eggs, bacon and mushrooms. Overall, the Carlton is a good base for seeing the city (and very close to the Prado and Reina Sofia museums) and represents good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Kemper_Forbes
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a good base for seeing Madrid, albeit slightly outside the centre. The hotel is easy to reach from the airport by Metro and costs only 2 Euros each. It is near to 2 Metro stations plus the Atocha Renfe railway station. The Metro is clean and frequent and we saw no obvious signs of the pickpocketing mentioned in other reviews. The room itself was very large and had good facilities. However there is a very limited selection of English channels on the TV unless you access the pay-tv (not what was planned but unanticipated sickness led us to a quieter than expected Saturday night!). Also internet access in reception is by credit card only - and there is a minimum charge. Wi-fi is available in the rooms but at 9 Euros a day you would probably be better of going to an internet cafe. We fully recommend a MadridCard if you intend to do the tourist thing - we bought a 72 hour pass costing 68 Euros - this included as many Vision tourbus rides as you wanted, the Zoo, Madrid Funfair, Faunia, museums and galleries and also gave discounts in shops and restaurants. However if you do decide to go to the Zoo and/or the Funfair, get the Metro to Batan - or reduce shoe leather getting there. But best of all - Chocolate con churros - fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Emma Dillon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel last week (from 2nd Jan to the 6th Jan 2008) It's a great hotel. Spotlessly clean, friendly staff, great location etc. I think we must have stayed in a newly renovated room because it was lovely. Massive bed, flat screen TV on the wall. plently of wardrobe space and drawers, big bathroom - which was clean and tiled. This hotel was excellent for us. Close to two metro stations and also a lovely walk away from the museums and parks. For breakfast there was lots of choice and the food was fantastic. Cereals, pastries, hot food, toast, juice, cheese, ham, fruit, coffee and selection of tea, smoked salmon, bread etc...! Good choice of hotel for Madrid. If you are planning a city break to Madrid, Toledo is well worth a visit - amazing ancient town. Tickets are really easy to buy from the train station (Atocha) really near to the hotel and it only takes 30 minutes to get there. You won't regret going!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in OK location”
Reviews.Author: englishalan
Reviews.Content: Great accommodation on 6th floor overlooking side street, hence quiet. Breakfast 13 euros but very extensive. Easy walk down to Frontera metro, or up to town to Atocha and museums. Use Carlton website for access by metro from airport; it sounds difficult but is easy - the hard part is getting to the Metro from Terminal1! DON'T try Nuevos Ministerios station as transfer is tortuous, and pickpockets very obvious on Circle Line(6).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, OK Location”
Reviews.Author: taniah
Reviews.Content: The hotel was rated 4* and had a lovely big room and bathroom. It is close to the Atocha metro for travel around Madrid and very close to the Atocha RENFE station for onwards travel around Spain. The hotel has many facilities including a restaurant, spa and internet, although we did not make use of these. The location is close to both the Prado and Rena Sofia museums but there is a lack of good quality dining options close to the hotel and you must venture further into the centre of Madrid, using the Metro. One thing which I found good (and unusual) is that there is an outside shutter you can control from in your room, totally shutting out the light and noise (not that there was much anyway) if that bothers you. All in all, a great stay in a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fourstaronly
Reviews.Content: Up the hill from the metro stop Frontera Yellow line 3. We had an excellent King size bed in a really nice room. Our room was at the back of the hotel which made it really quiet. Really clean hotel with good english speaking staff who were very helpfull. Was only dissappointed with Madrid itself. Heard of a number of people who were pickpocketed. Good shopping and eating down the hill from the metro stop Barrio del plar Line 9 Purple. Good hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, good location”
Reviews.Author: SEC67
Reviews.Content: Pleasent, comfortable hotel in a good location - we did not notice noise from busy road. Room was a fair size as was bathroom. Buffet breakfast had plenty of choice. Reasonable value for money - had enjoyable couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE & LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: cliveoHerts
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just south of the city centre it is on a busy road but the noise can not be heard once inside. There is a parking arangement with a secure carpark a couple of streets away for 12 euros a day. The staff were all polite and helpfull the room i had was well equiped and very modern with air con , shower and whirlpool bath. I was on a business trip so did not explore much but two of the main museums were only 5&10 mins away also the station is only across the road. You can walk to all the main tourist areas in 30 mins.

Reviews.Title: “No probs here”
Reviews.Author: paulde
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend having read the other reviews, and it didn't disappoint. Arrived late but there were no probs - with a very friendly guy (Francesco) on the desk (I did meet the dreaded Jesus when leaving, and can see why he'd come over as brusque, but personally I've no complaints). The location is perfect for me, since it's close to the musuems and station as noted, but also just a 15-20 minute walk (or stagger) from town, which was great for walking off the copious quantities of tapas & Sangria consumed. I love Madrid, will definitely be coming back and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: susanna.chow
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious with large wardrobes. The toilet is spacious with all the necessary amenities. The breakfast is a very good start for the day. However, the hotel is offering expensive internet access. It will be far better if it can provide such service free of charge inside the room. The hotel staff are not too helpful and enthusiastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Breakfast, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: QB1975
Reviews.Content: We (myself and my wife) stayed in this hotel between 18-20 August 2007 for 2 nights. It is near Atocha train station (it takes 10 minutes by walking) and close to Reina Sofia and Prado museums (same walking distance). There are 2 metro stations near the hotel: Atocha (10 minutes walk) and Palos de la Frontera (5 minutes). It is better to use the second metro station (Palos de la Frontera) since that street is safer to walk (as we observed) to the hotel. We stayed for 70 € / night (price of double room) - breakfast and VAT included. Breakfast was superb. It was among the best I ever seen in Spain. Although hotel is close to the Atocha train station, the rooms are quiet. During the night, we did not hear any noise from the neighbour rooms or from the street. There is safe in the room but it is not included in the price. You pay 1.8€/day. It is not so much, rent it. You should ask reception for the key. There are 3 supermarkets (Names: Opencar, Lidt, ??) near the hotel. They are on the way to the Palos de la Frontera metro station. Air condition and elevator were working and they were OK. Hotel rooms need renovation. This was the only bad thing we experienced at this hotel. We recommend this hotel to anyone who goes to Madrid for leisure / work. Good value for money !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for Museums”
Reviews.Author: A1Curtis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton Hotel 22nd-25th July 2007. The hotel is in an excellent location for the museums, bus routes and metro stops for other locations around Madrid. Thanks to a previous trip advisor (Isabellrea from Leicestershire in Dec 2006) for the directions to the hotel, we found the hotel really easily from the airport. We asked for a quiet room – which we received facing a fire escape. The room was a good size, very clean and on the fifth floor. Very good selection for breakfast – best I have seen for a while. I highly recommend staying at the Carlton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: RLS1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton Hotel with two friends for a couple of nights in July 2007. We had a triple room and found it to be very spacious. Two sinks in the bathroom and a separate dressing area are very useful when three girls need to get ready! We had breakfast in the hotel and found the food to be of good quality, although it was a bit expensive (12 Euros each). The staff were very helpful and kept the breakfast room open for us even though we arrived there 5 minutes after it should have closed! The hotel is located centrally, just a few minutes walk from Atocha station. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short break in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - Dated Interiors - No Good or Bad Extremes”
Reviews.Author: curiouspaddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in June 2007. It is an OK hotel - nothing too wonderful or terrible about it, although the four star rating is probably a bit too much for what it is. Three stars would be more appropriate. ROOMS The rooms are quite dated (at least where we were) and the bathroom is in serious need of an update. The beds are big and comfortable and there is enough room to move around without bumping in to your bags. LOCATION The location cannot be faulted. It is a 3 minute walk to either Atocha station or the Reina Sofia gallery. RECEPTION One thing that did leave a bad taste was the poor advice we were given when asking for a good restaurant. We all expect that they have their "favourites", but we were sent to a place where the only other people eating were from our hotel and they insisted that we needed them to reserve a table! I felt as though we were taken advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location (to train station)”
Reviews.Author: mcnallyb
Reviews.Content: Great service is never expected in Spain, so I was not disappointed when Jesus (same night manager as another review) wasn't friendly when checking in late, but the location is perfect for a train arrival. We arrived late and Carlton Hotel is only 2 blocks from the Atocha. HUGE rooms and bathrooms. Good value. Just needed a room for one night before flying out in the morning. Stayed at Hotel Preciados for the beginning of the vacation. Probably wouldn't stay here for a vacation (many other hotels with better locations) but perfect for in and out on the last night of our trip

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful and unfriendly staff.... verging on being rude.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_HW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in May 07 arrived late evening around 11.30pm (airline lost our luggage so we were not in the best of moods) but Jesus (staff member) at reception made our arrival much more unpleasant then needed. Firstly he gave us a twin room (we requested a double weeks before) and he told us hotel was fully booked and the rooms available are business suites for single travellers ( these are on the higher floors). Then after a few minutes he said he can give double room (so he lied before). We got to the room, door would close but wouldn't lock... luckily we checked otherwise anyone could enter our room whilst we were out. This was room 805 (it's on the 1st floor)... so if you get this room do check if they've fixed the problem!! We requested another room because it was obvious that reception staff couldn't fix the problem. They put us in the business suites on a higher floor, the bed was ridiculously small for two people ( just slightly bigger than a single) and furniture was seriously dated and old. It was obvious that the room was for single business travellers (because Jesus told us right at the start). But NOW he was trying to tell us the room is for two people ( he lied again). He said there were no more rooms. By now we were losing patience he was being extremely rude. A few minutes later he moved us again to room 806 which was fine. This room is next to room 805 (the one with the dodgy door).... so it was obvious that the hotel had rooms available but he was simply being extremely difficult... he could have moved us into room 806 straightaway without causing all this hassle. The whole process took over one hour, with 3 room changes (it was 1am before all of this got sorted) and not once was there an apology or any offer to compensate us. I expected much better service from a 4* hotel. Day staff just as unfriendly. Also beware the shower runs hot and cold. They also charge 2 euros per day for using the safe. Note that rooms on the 1st floor are newly refurbished and the ones on the higher floors are old and dated. There are so many hotels in Madrid I would choose to go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, large rooms, recommended”
Reviews.Author: richardlondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early May 07 and were impressed with the Carlton. While the hotel is generally a little dated in appearance, our room was large, quiet and very comfortable. Staff were helpful and spoke good English (eg: a request for some ice at 11.30pm was no problem and appeared in just a few minutes). The breakfast (included in our rate) was truly excellent. This combined with the overall room rate meant that the Carlton offered excellent value for money. The hotel location is slightly out of the way but is still close to all the main attractions. FYI - There's a modern, late night convenience store just a few doors (against the traffic flow) down from the hotel. However just walk 3 mins more, on the opposite side of the road is an excellent (and much cheaper) supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for art lovers, ham aficionados. Excellent value, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Toulouse_Yankee
Reviews.Content: The Carlton is a good hotel for art lovers. As many other reviewers have remarked, it is walking distance from Madrid's three great art museums: El Prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen-Bornemisza. It's also right near the Atocha train station. The hotel itself is clean, comfortable and friendly. The rooms are a bit business-like, without great character, but more spacious than in many hotels of its class, and with many amenities. Nice big bath sheets. We had a quiet room on the inside court which is more a large shaft than court. Thus, no view to speak of. The street in front is busy and noisy so we were glad to have an inside room. As noted by others, the breakfast buffet is exceptional – ham in five forms! and a great array of breakfast pastries, fresh fruits, cereals and cheeses – and was included in our room rate. All in all, very good value. There are two computer terminals in the lobby which can be activated with a credit card; 30 minutes for 2€, for example. This was our first trip to Madrid and we chose the Carlton on the recommendation of a friend associated with El Prado. There are plenty of restaurants and wine bar-and-tapas places in the area, notably the delightful and spirited Bodega Rosell, though one restaurant padded our bill and tried to overcharge us by 12€. Unfortunately, it was a restaurant recommended by the desk clerk who was soon apprised of our experience there. Madrid is a beautiful city, its inhabitants relaxed and friendly, magnificent architecture and art, food and wine. We look forward to return visits.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Good Value Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RebelDJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a three day business trip. Convenient location for Atocha station - this is why I chose it. Fair price of 75euro per night, breakfast at 11,50 euro - very competitive in Madrid. Not many Restaurants in the vicinity, but with a metro so cheap and convenient, that's not a worry. Wireless Internet at 15 euro for 24 hours is a little steep. All things considered though I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Presidento
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated a litte out of the main shopping area of the Grand Via, however, this is made up by having the Famous PRADOE art gallery and the Queen Sofia modern art gallery both within a 10 minute stroll. If you wish to go further affield from the Hotel, there are Metro stops quite close. The metro system is very simple to use and spotless. In fact Madrid is the cleanest City we have visited, I have never seen so many Street Cleaners. There are a number of Cafe's and Resteraunts close to the Hotel and plenty of Tapas bars. You will find the all the staff at the Carlton only to willing to help with any problems that arrise. BEWARE there is one WARNING I must advise you of. PICKPOCKETS, Whislt walking near the Pradoe my wife and I were approached from behind and Tomato Ketchup was sprayed on our backs, when my wife noticed, two men suddenly appeared and offered tissues to help with the clean up. Fortunately my wife had noted one who stood in a doorway and nodded to the others. She shouted and told the men to go, which they did very quickly. It's a new one on me but it just goes to show you must be on your guard.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Enixam
Reviews.Content: This Hotel well situated just five minutes from Atocha Station. Breakfast not included in price but was available at an extra cost. Hotel very clean .We asked for a quiet room which we were given . Sirens blare all night in this city,especially Sat. nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value hotel Carlton Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Paisley_49
Reviews.Content: Partner and I stayed at the Carlton for a long weekend, and were very pleased with every aspect of the hotel. Great loaction near to the railway station and museums and parks almost on the doorstep. The rooms I would say are of average size for a major city hotel , but were very modern and spotlessly clean. We were happy to have a room at the back of the hotel for the peace and quiet, tho the view was of the fire escape, but hey we came to Madrid to get out and about. Staff were competent english speakers and helpful when asked! We booked a Bed and Breakfast deal with Easy-jet and was great value for £150 for the 3 nights. Breakfast is buffet style with plenty of choice and the quality was very good indeed Yes, If we visit Mardrid again would be booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good 4 stars hotel in busy street”
Reviews.Author: jwmpet
Reviews.Content: We visited the Carlton Hotel in Madrid from March 25th – 29th 2006. It is an excellent four stars hotel situated in a busy, broad one-way street. We had a room on the 5th floor at the street side. Because of the double glazed windows the noise of the traffic was not too intrusive, at least when you do not sleep with an open window. This leads to another problem: for me it was much too warm at night and the airco was centrally switched off. Reason: the fluctuating temperature outside the hotel (I always thought that inside temperature is decisive to use the airco!). Nevertheless the room was very good: spacious, very clean, good mattresses and (if you wish) two pillows per person, a bathroom with bath, and shower and a mini-bar. The breakfast is abundant and of good quality. We once took dinner in the hotel which was simple but of very good quality at a reasonable price. There is a bar with room service without extra costs. The staff is very kind and helpful. To reach the hotel from the airport take Metro nr.8 to Nuevo Ministri and than the suburban train (called CERCANIAS) to Atocha, but mind that you have to buy two different tickets. Tickets for the Metro (6,15 euro per 10) are not valid for the train (5,65 per 10). The hotel is about 400 meters from Atocha Renfe station. Tip: at the backside of the Centro de Arte Reina Sofia Museum ( a very interesting one about 400 meters from the hotel) you will find a cosy bar-restaurant El Tres. There you can have a very good menu for 8 euro including half a bottle of wine. We booked through Alpharooms at a price of 273,46 euro for four nights including breakfast and there were no extra costs.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to the Museums”
Reviews.Author: Bussines-CA
Reviews.Content: I spend part of my honeymoon on the Carlton, the rooms need some work, but the breakfast is included and the rate is very affordable. If you are traveling to Madrid to see the museums, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: eylon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Carlton for 4 days around Christmas 2005. The first reason for choosing this hotel was the positive opinions read on this site. The second was the price: around 80 Euros per night for 2 people including breakfast. Regarding the hotel's advantages: good location, very close to Madrid's major attractions which are all within walking distance (we haven't use public transportation). It is also close to Atocha station (for those willing to visit Toledo, now only 35 minutes with the quick train "AVE"). Breakfast is excellent with lot of hot and cold choices. Staff is nice , polite and helpful. The hotel is clean and looks like having been recently renovated. The rooms, although of average size, are comfortable and well decorated. One major inconvenient is the noise caused by neighbouring rooms (especially bathroom noise). The first night, someone in the room above was taking showers from 10 to 11 PM which sounded as if we were using our bathroom. The same story started the day after at 7 AM. We asked the reception to move us to another room which they did (hoping that this noise was related to a single room). But the same story started again (different hours and slightly less noisy, but still too much considering it's a 4 stars hotel). All in all, we had a pleasant stay at this hotel and I consider it as a very good choice especially considering the price paid. If the hotel could improve room isolation, it would be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering”
Reviews.Author: Regdor
Reviews.Content: We chose this from previous reviews and would recommend staying here. Location, walking =, 5 mins to Reina Sophia gallery, 20 mins to Prado. Building works at Atocha station are cutting off main walking route to Retiro park/Botannical gardens. Need to divert over road. Do not risk walking around barrier it is a long way!!! Room Standard 405, modern, clean , clever design with sliding doors make most of limited space, tiny bathroom. Seems to be aimed at single business traveller. Overlooks VERY busy road, even with double glazing traffic noise intrudes, sirens and horns. Beds firm but to our taste, pillows useless bolster type, we asked for another which was delivered in 5 mins. If we went again i would price a larger room, as a couple staying for 5 nights we would try to afford a bit more space. There is very little public space to sit and read and rest those aching legs after the Prado! Staff very nice, speak good english. Breakfast excellent, all self service with the brilliant Rosa overseeing everything. I would agree with others who sing her praises, i hope the hotel recognise what a star they have!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and central”
Reviews.Author: kuiken
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant stay in this hotel during the four days we spent in Madrid. The room was tidy and clean, and everything we needed was there. A litlle bathroom, but did we need a bigger one: No. TV-set unfortunately there were too much channels we could not understand the language. To less English, French or German. Breakfest was good, and the ladies, especially the cook was working very hard. They did there best, every morning. They made you feel welcome. A good variety of food. There was a locker available to put our suitcases in, so we could spent some more time in the city after checking-out. Conclusion: a pleasant hotel for a few days in wonderfull Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near museums”
Reviews.Author: Biarritz
Reviews.Content: Really surprised at getting such a good value hotel in capital of Spain near museums. Rooms reasonable size and clean. Good breakfast. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth a look”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in April, 2005, top-and-tailing a midweek trip to León in Castile. The Carlton is excellent value and well-placed - one street over from the Atocha railway station and 15 mins. walk from the Prado Museum. The decor is modern, the staff helpful and friendly and the catering first-rate. We'd certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Ali83
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights at the end of February 2005. It is an amazing hotel for the price. My friend and I had a standard twin room - this was much larger than one normally expects in a capital city and included space for a table and two armchairs and plenty of wardrobe space etc. Staff were courteous and helpful. The breakfast which was included in our deal was very varied and catered for all tastes. The restaurant in the hotel has a good value menu del dia which was a relief after having struggled through the metro in the rush hour on the day of our arrival. (To avoid a fairly convoluted metro journey from the airport you can take the metro from Aeropuerto to Nuevos Ministerios and then change on to the suburban railway to Atocha). The hotel is well placed for the major art museums and the metro into old Madrid.

HotelInfo.Name: AC Hotel Carlton Madrid by Marriott
HotelInfo.Address: Paseo De Las Delicias 26, 28045 Madrid, Spain
